description: Old stomping grounds for a Balboa high school graduate, Class of 2010 checking in. Everything here is a complete and utter bang for your buck bargain. Cheaper than an l&l or ono Hawaiian and it's located in a pretty busy part of the city. Also they hand prep/make everything in house. Mac salad is super fire always ask for one scoop of rice and 2 scoops of Mac salad. Can't go wrong with a large or small plate of katsu. Still come here at least 3-4 times a year to see what they are cooking like. This place has been a staple for me throughout high school and fed me well. My usual order is chicken mix plate (half bbq half katsu chicken) and a couple of spam musubis. Fyyuuhhhhh
author: Tofu S.

description:
Pretty damn ono, bro.

I got the barbecue chicken mini plate, spam musubi, and guava Hawaiian Sun alongside it all. FOR TEN DOLLARS. Yo, I think we have yet another winner winner, chicken dinner. Quite literally.

The mini plate came with rice, macaroni salad, a little bit of cabbage, and a whole LOT of tender, marinated chicken. Standard components of a mini plate, but they give you a much more generous portion than most other Hawaiian restos (you know which chain I'm talking about!). As tasty as the chicken was, the musubi, I have to say, was the stand out star. The spam/rice ratio was perfection and the nori they use? BOMB. It was thicker than usual and had a unique crisp quality to it. Amaze! And who could be mad at an ice-cold can of guava juice to wash it all down? Not I. No, not I.

This will be a staple of Vi's new neighborhood eats, you can quote me on that.
author: Vi T.

description:
So I've come to learn that not all Hawaiian Drive Inns in the bay area are the same.  The locations have different menu options and there isn't really consistency in how they cook their food.  The one in terms of food, is definitely one of the better ones.  But I will say in terms of cleanliness, and service it's not the best (not a big deal to me as I always get my food to-go, but if service and sitting down are your thing this probably isn't the best place for you.)

I've tried a bunch of the menu items here including the Loco Moco, Teri Chicken, Steak, and Short ribs, Chicken Katsu and Spam Musubis.  The prices are pretty good and the portions are big.  The loco mocos are always really good because who doesn't love gravy?  But really all the menu items are good (except maybe the Teri Steak because it wasn't marinated long enough and they overcook it a bit.)  Aside from that, I definitely recommend a visit!
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
As expected at a "Drive Inn", service was quick. With a very serious (sardonic) woman taking the orders and grabbing the cash. It was my first visit to this FOUR STAR joint and I was kinda expecting a whiff of dat good ole "Hawaiian Aloha Spirit". Yooo know da kine. Nope. About as much Aloha Spirit as watching a meter maid write you a $65 love note for the parking meter that expired 15 seconds ago. 

A steady stream fans flowed in. BBQ short ribs & chicken combo w/ macaroni salad on a bed of coarsely cut crunchy cabbage. Piled in a clear plastic container with very wimpy plastic fork and knife.  Wrapped in a single tiny paper napkin the utensils posed an eating challenge; I looked around to see if this was the set of a hidden camera TV joke show. Nope. Thank King Kamehameha, they had chopsticks (on request only, since they are kept in a locked drawer beneath the closely monitored cash register). 

The clump called macaroni salad, bore NO resemblance to its namesake. The chicken & short ribs were salty, chicken was tender (and salty) the ribs were quite sturdy (and salty). The bed of rough cut raw cabbage seemed to be the "must have a veggie" in the mix. White rice was overcooked (mushy), and no that is not Hawaiian style. Summary, for the price of 10 bucks I guess it is better than McDonalds, but it ain't Ono Ono. Ahh, brah me must rememba Ima in da outta mission, not in 
Hanapepe.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Hole-in-the-wall eatery serving tasty food with generous portions. It's a tough call between chicken katsu curry and the chicken cutlet with gravy.
author: Samantha L.

description: Love this place.  Chicken katsu is always crispy, short rib is yummy.  Spam musubis are great.  Quick service as well!  Highly recommend!
author: Siv L.

description:
CASH only. Parking may be hard to find nearby. 

This place is usually pretty busy especially around lunch time, usually I see one lady taking orders and doing the register while helping with the fryer and bagging orders while the cook handles the grill. 

The service is usually pretty quick, but don't expect the lady to be talkative or friendly. I usually come here for their musubis - inexpensive ($1.90) and SO GOOD. Usually two will fill me up. If you only have five dollars on you, and you are in this neighborhood, this is the spot to go. 

Chicken katsu musubi (4.5 stars) - The katsu is very crispy and chicken is very tender + yummy musubi sauce + rice - all wrapped in seaweed. Very comforting treat. DEFINITELY recommend eating this while it's still hot and crispy!

Chicken musubi (3.5 stars) - This is different from the katsu. This is bbq chicken musubi, pretty tasty but can be a bit too salty because of the sauce. 

Spam musubi (3.5 stars) - Just as described, it's a spam musubi. The spam is already salty and there is musubi sauce on top of that, which makes it even saltier. The rice gives your palate some balance but this is definitely not something I should be eating all the time.

They have many other options here, which I'm sure are good too. I've had the chicken katsu plate a long time ago and they came in big portions. They come with chicken katsu, katsu sauce, a couple rice domes and macaroni salad. 

Highly recommend this Hawaiian place on this end of Mission Street.
author: Amy T.

description: Been coming here since middle school. Couldn't ask for better food in the hood for a good price. Switch it up between the Katsu, seafoood combo, masubis and burger. Always come here and get your money's worth. Solid family owned business.
author: Manny R.

description:
This place is super cheap. It's certainly a great value for Hawaiian BBQ. I came here on a rainy day and easily found parking right outside the restaurant. It was quite empty inside (likely due to the rain).

Their meat platter dish was a huge hit. It's so much food. We could barely finish
author: Jackie W.

description:
I love the Hawaiin Drive-In in SSF.
Love the food, but this place is foul.
The girl behind the counter was wearing blue nitrile gloves that she was using to make food while also cleaning up. I saw her pick up trash off the floor and clean tables while wearing the SAME gloves. Totally unsanitary and disgusting. I will never step foot in this place again.
I should call the health department cause they are going to get somebody sick. They need to learn safe food handling procedures.
author: Victor G.

description:
It's been the standard to Hawaiian food in San Francisco since I've been alive. 

I've tried the other Hawaiian places that have come and gone and nothing is as good as this little hole in the wall restaurant in excelsior district. 

They have a 2nd location in Daly City but they aren't as good as this one.
author: Rio J.

description: This place has the biggest and cheapest portions of Hawaiian food I've ever seen. Chicken katsu is excellent, spam musubi delicious although it is a lot of rice they should make the spam slice bigger or just put less rice. And the spam eggs and rice dish is super filling. They're very generous with their rice, chicken katsu, and mac salad portions. The mac salad is ok not much taste, but everything else is very tasty. And for the cheap prices you just can't beat it.
author: Dianne E.

description:
When I think of a mom and pop shop, this place hits home run. It is the definition of HOLE in the freaken WALL. You won't find overrated teriyaki here! I like how the kitchen is right up front where you can sneak a peek at that grill action behind the corner. The portions are pretty generous and one meal can easily fill two people.

Support local businesses friends!!
author: Mary L.

description: Hawaiian drive inn is re opened once again !!! They are done with their remodel!!! Super excited
author: Jenmy M.

description: Get here early before all the high school kids get out and crowd this place. I got here a bit before 4 pm and ordered the pork chop plate. It came with 3 pork chops, 2 scoops of rice, and a scoop of macaroni salad for $7.49! The pork was marinated with teriyaki, the rice was sticky, and the mac salad was plain but delicious. There's not much room for seating, and most people take out. Super cheap food that's super tasty!
author: Ha D.

description: Uhm most legit Hawaiian food spot in the city. I've gone and tried a bunch trying to find something close to being actual Hawaiian local favorites and THIS IS IT!  It's also the price that Hawaiian food SHOULD BE. Did you hear that you hipsters out there? Don't be trying to charge me like $30 for a BBQ plate, drink, and spam musubi. My boyfriend and I can come here and get a full meal that is SO DAMN tasty and priced what it should be. This is THE only legit spot in the city. Done be fooled by those other overpriced overly juju'd up spots. Just cus they sell Hawaiian Sun don't mean they the real thing.
author: Noelle C.

description: #1 Hawaiian BBQ Chicken and Spam Musubi are automatic. They remodeled recently so the place is looking extra spiffy, also if you're more of a chicken katsu  fan that's on point as well... gotta have the Katsu sause!
author: Daniel R.

description: Best Hawaiian drive in. Killer mac salad
author: Alan M.

description:
BEST Value - $3.75 Double Cheeseburger.  Served hot and fresh!  Basic Simple Food will jump down your gullet and you won't stop until you lick your fingers.  I am the Yumster...goo goo de goo!
A friendly place.  Mostly take-out rice plates.
author: Geri S.

description: Spam musubi is to die for and only $1.3!! Run by an old couple and their health rating is 90. Other foods were all so good. Highly recommended.
author: Ah M.

description: Portions of food is huge at a relatively good price. The right is a little dry if you do not plan to put any sauce on it.
author: Nelson H.

description:
This is one of my favorite places in Excelsior district, lots of food for price ( seafood combo with short ribs and combination plate ) are our usual.
Quick service, less than 10 minutes when ordering on phone to go.
They just renovate this place late last year 2017, it was close for more than a month then but they are back in Bussiness.
I recommend it
author: Frank V.

description: Love this spot! They are the best. Out of all the spots in the Bay Area this is the one to go too!
author: Margarita V.

description: Hole in the wall type place, nothing fancy. If your here for just the food then I def recommend it. Not your best place to dine in unless u wanna sit but I can say it's more of a take out place. Got the bbq chicken sandwich, fries and a chicken Katy's musubi and I enjoyed it all. Fries were ok but the musubi and sandwich were great for the price. Cheap food, don't forget to bring cash tho! Lady at register looked pissed off but I got my food so I'm happy :)
author: Suzan P.

description:
5 stars for Excelsior... for those who don't know, this means a lot. One of the best hole-in-the-walls in this neighborhood for sure. I came here after a recommendation from Ruby C. (thanks Ruby!!) and the rest is history as they say. It was love at first bite.

I don't have too much experience with chicken katsu, so all I can say is that my taste buds were very pleased. For $5, you can get a mini portion that is actually massive- complete with white rice and macaroni salad. Roommate had the lemon chicken and she enjoyed it but did say the sauce borderline tasted like lemon-aide.

Occasionally I am a creature of habit, and when I find something that I love, I will come back again and again and stay loyal for a very long time. This is definitely one of those places I will come for a reliable, tasty meal. They're open til 9:30 which is handy for pseudo late night eats. Cash only unfortunately, but there's a bank of america close by. I would also recommend calling in your order so you don't have to wait if you're taking it to go. 

Plenty of seating. Parking is a little scarce, but there is residential parking just a few streets up or down of Mission. 

Looking forward to trying the spam musubi and lumpia next time.
author: Steph D.

description:
I have been going here since high school... 2010? and i've never been disappointed in anything i've ordered here.  The food is good, big portions and the people that work here are super sweet.

Cheeseburger and fries - SOLID. definitely more on the greasy side and is going to be the cheat meal of the week.  The fries portions is also huge!!! They offer a meal deal as well with burger and fries.

BBQ chicken, katsu, bbq ribs - all marinated well and not too salty.

Each regular plate you get can probably be shared or you will have leftovers!!! Bbq mini plate is what i suggest most people to get. It comes with the meat, macaroni salad, and rice. 

Another thing i love here are the spam and chicken katsu musubis if you are just trying to have a snack. YUM!!

Definitely recommend this place over some of the other hawaiian places. It's a bit greasy, but what's fast food without grease?  great people, food and portions and it always keeps me coming back!

note: CASH only!!!!
author: Josie L.

description: I really only got the tonkatsu . It's hella good fresh . The portions are nice , where you can get a mini plate or a larger plate , both relatively cheep. Oh also the place may look a little janky, but it's still bomb
author: Nathan W.

description: I found a hair on my tomato for my health plate. I'm not eating here again. They need to have kitchen staff to wear hair nets if they are working with food. Who can stand to eat there again if there is hair on the food? I won't be ordering anything again after this incident.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Hawaiian Drive Inn is my dirty little secret. Literally. 

It's the type of place that Gwyneth Paltrow would get her pristinely white silk granny panties all up in a bunch.

For one, just standing inside Hawaiian Drive Inn would turn her porcelain skin to the shade of Kim K's greasy butt. Yah, I know...old news but that greasy butt that Kanye taps will forever be ingrained in my head. Thanks, Paper magazine. 

Yeup, it's dirty and grimy but Hawaiian Drive Inn is ridiculously cheap and the portions are insanely huge for SF standards (prices have barely increased since my college days). With nothing over $7.75, you can get a gut-busting meal (with leftovers) that costs less than a McD value meal. Cash only.

Don't expect much for the price though. It's quantity over quality here. Regular lunch plates ($6.39-$7.75) come with two heaping scoops of overcooked, clumpy rice, a scoopful of mushy mac salad drowning in mayo, and your choice of a carniwhorous meat pile: Loco Moco, BBQ Short Ribs, BBQ Chicken, Pork Chops, Chicken Katsu, etc. 

To feel less like a gluttonous pig, they have mini meals for $4.99: one scoop of rice, one scoop of mac salad, and your choice of protein. 

Not a fan of msg-y, salty, saucy items like me (IMO, their BBQ is too salty)? Then, the Chicken Katsu is the way to go: http://bit.ly/1DmN60c. It's two layers of hot, extra crunchy, and decently tender fried chicken cutlets. Just don't tell me where they source their chicken from because in this case, ignorance is bliss. Cheap, gluttonous, and greasy bliss.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: If you're a fan of flavorless chicken and starched flavored macaroni and over cooked rice then this is the place for you.. I cook better than that. Not Hawaiian style at all!
author: Amine M.

description: They give a lot of chicken katsu. 367g to be specific for my own order of a regular sized chicken katsu order. If this place had better Mac salad tho I'd give them 5 stars.
author: Alvin D.

description: What I usually call this place is the Ghetto Hawaiian BBQ near my house, but it sure doesn't look like a hole in the wall after they renovated the entire restaurant. They closed the restaurant for a few months in the beginning of summer and the place is super clean at the moment. It would be nice for it to stay this way for decades to come. It's also a nice to see a long time business to make an investment and keep their businesses open despite the high costs to run a business and the need to remodel, most businesses close because of the need to remodel. On the first few weeks when they reopened, the food tasted very bland and had no flavor. I just remembered that they replaced their equipment and the oil in the deep fryer tasted very new. I decided to wait a few weeks before coming back and the food tasted so much better. Think of the theory of a wok or dim sum steamer, they retain flavor of the previous cooking. I usually get their Chicken Katsu plate with all Macaroni. They don't charge extra if you want one type of side. The same old friendly staff running the place, sometimes I would chat with them in Cantonese while I wait for my food. Even though the prices went up a little I am willing to pay more for their food, since they did spend thousands to remodel the entire restaurant.
author: Peter C.

description:
Food is affordable and plentiful. A get 2 teriyaki chicken plates. one  to eat their and one to take home.
Kmac
author: Kenny M.

description: This has been a go-to since high school! They're fast and really good food! Love their macaroni salad!
author: Jessica W.

description:
The hole in the wall that has been around for as long as I can remember serving out enormous amounts of food for the money. This is by no means a luxury restaurant, it's a divey, use whatever you got to make it happen type of place. Mom and pop to fullest and that's what makes it a favorite of mine. 

The staff is awesome and the food comes out hot and crispy! From the Katsu to the shrimp, short ribs to the BBQ chicken, it's all on point! Everything on the menu is exactly what it seems, damn good... Did I mention the portions? The mini meals will feed a linebacker and the regular size can feed a small family. Where else can you feed four people for less than 15 bucks including tax!?!

The mini meals include one scoop of rice and your choice of meats, chicken, fish or shrimp. And the regular plates come with two scoops and your choice of the said items above. There are also fish sandwiches and burger meals that come with fries and a drink. 

Make sure and try the Masubi's, they are legit my kryptonite...
author: Josh H.

description: Ate here the day before yesterday its very inexpensive nd you get larger portions of food they recently remodeled the place and it looks way better .. I order the same thing from here everytime  Large Chicken Katus with only rice the food came out pretty quickly..  I only didnt give 5 stars because the woman who takes the food orders was kind of rude when i asked her for extra napkins and saracha ,but other than that every thing else was ok.
author: Amber W.

description: Awesome portions, awesome prices, tastes great.  Friendly owners.  Disregard Cherylynn N.'s review.  The quality is just fine for the rest of us non-caviar eating 99% people.
author: Javier G.

description: Taste great with great prices. There portions are very fair, the shop itself is basic with basic staff(get your order done nothing more.) but they allow there food to speak for itself. Of course assuming your not into the snobby food scene.
author: Potato F.

description: Best quick Katsu hands down. Cheaper than other places you get a large Katsu for super cheap and it's super amazing
author: Juan J.

description: My favorite Hawaiian BBQ place in the area. They are cash only though. Not much seating inside. I always order to-go anyway. Their portions are very generous. Parking can be tough in the area. Glad they have reopened.
author: Baron T.

description:
This is THE place to go get your Hawaiian fix for the price. They plug it up with more than a normal person can eat straight up! The place is pretty small and not the cleanest but most people from what I've witnessed just order to go. I've probably ate here more times than I can count on my fingers and toes but I've sat in once and constantly had to fight off a stubborn fly. I always go with the BBQ  Mix plate or the chicken cutlet and katsu. Feel free to always let them know to give less rice and more macroni salad. 

The owners here are some hard working folks considering they work through holidays and possibly 365 days of the year. When every food joint on the block next to them is closed on Christmas Eve, you can be certain their restaurant is still running feeding hangry folks like myself.
author: Eric H.

description: A hole in the wall joint. Ordered the loco moco which I thought was super tasty and it was only $8. We also had the spam musubu for around $2 each and it was delicious. I would definitely return.
author: Eric T.

description: Fun place and good food for the whole family. Really enjoyed on our trip back to Bay Area. Will be back to try the bbq again very soon.
author: Jean V.

description: Not bad food, we got a Loco Moco, Teri Steak, and spam musubis.  The prices are fair, the food was good and meh.  The Loco Moco was great, hamburger patty was well seasoned, egg perfectly cooked and gravy delicious.  The macaroni was even great which I normally don't like.  The Teri Steak was okay, not that flavorful and a little dry.  The spam musubis had great flavor but the sauce on the spam was not evenly distributed.  Overall, good hole in the wall hawaiian places are difficult to find, so I think this was a good 4 star place.  Would come here again if I was in the area.
author: Alexander C.

description: Love this place! I've been going here for years now! Super good and cheap! You won't be disappointed:)
author: Ina L.

description: This place is great. The food is tasty, the service is nice and friendly, and the prices are fair. I will go back soon!
author: Gaby L.

description:
When I think of drive-ins, I think of pulling up my ride into a diner and have a waiter on roller skates taking your order.  Some places in Hawaii do it, I am certain of that.

Unfortunately, you won't get that in San Francisco, especially along lengthy Mission Street. Obviously the Cantonese owner(s) does not know what was he and/or she was thinking. 

However, you will get Hawaiian meals at an affordable price. For dinner, I had the Chicken Katsu meal for $7.00. The meal has thick and crunchy fried boneless Chicken breast cooked Hawaiian-style, two-scoops of macaroni salad and two-scoops of rice. This small restaurants' version is generous and legit. My only 
problem is that the restaurant adds too much mayonnaise in the macaroni salad. 

This little place is a popular hangout for high-school kids. Some of them have shown their childish behavior. 

It has been a while since I had Hawaiian-cuisine. The price is right. The atmosphere and location is indeed questionable.
author: Matt G.

description: Really delicious food for a cheap price. I spent about $23 for two dinners -- lemon chicken, chicken katsu, and a burger. Their burgers are incredibly cheap but delicious, just like In-N-Out. The service is quick too. I'd definitely come here again.
author: Patrick D.

description:
This is pretty much a hole in the wall, maybe a somewhat big hole. The entrance way is pretty narrow, and as you situate yourself you see the meat being grilled behind the counter and the old school menu above the grill. You order at the front and wait for your meal, and we had a bit of a wait since there were a good number of people ahead of us. The wait was not too long, though the area is a bit awkward with very limited seating (the eat-in tables are a bit far in the back), and most people getting their food to go would not go sit down anyway.

I enjoyed my BBQ chicken mini meal, which came with 3 cuts of chicken along with the usual rice, veggie salad, and mac salad. For less than $6, this was more than enough food--I suppose the regular portion would be suitable if you were extra hungry. The chicken was very tender and flavorful, while the salads provided a good contrast, particularly the mac. Finally, there wasn't substantial interaction with the restaurant staff, but the lady helpfully offered to wipe down the table for us before seating so that was a nice plus.
author: Tony D.

description:
The food has been consistent over the years coming here and absolutely amazing! Cant go wrong eating here....just dont look at the details like why the chefs have been wearing the same hats forever now. And the little mess around the cashier but youre not going for the table service!

This is the place to get your grub on for beat price to out does the great tasting. 

Now now dont be hitting on the customers here, boys or girls...7/10 they go to the high school around the block. Unless youre into that stuff...than ure a creep and should be hanged, but of course if youre under age..play ball. 

Theyre also super friendly too! They havent said no to anyone I seen to use their artful bathroom. Its really a museum seeing all the taggings and knowing where they keep some supplies in. 

Remember people, this is about the food and not about the owners spoiled children they might have that drive new lexus off the lot and go to some UC school to do drugs and party like a rockstar. Ignore all that and you might truly enjoy this place if you were thinking what i was...
author: Yosof R.

description: I ordered some tasty Hawaiian quisine, and was served a coconut with lemonade in it. It was okay, but it wasn't what I ordered at all. It was really bizarre.
author: Gooseman M.

description:
Hawaiian Drive Inn is my kind of fast food. Made to order, delicious grub at a great price. Kind of a random joint on Mission, and they're easy to overlook, but this little spot packs a big punch. They've been here for a while too. Back when I was in high school I used to buy their spam musubis all the time and keep them tucked away in my backpack for snack attacks. 

The Chicken Katsu plate has always been the star of the show for me. Perfectly fried and breaded pieces of chicken, cut up into strips, nestled next to mounds of luscious white rice and a scoop of classic macaroni salad. A mini plate ($5) is more than enough food for me, but if you want to share or have leftovers, the regular size plate (~$7) is the way to go. Oh and that sauce they give you...perfect for dipping or as a gravy for your rice! 

I've had the fries and the chicken teriyaki, loco moco, and bbq short rib plates too and everything is delicious.  Not the healthiest of meals, but it's a yummy treat stopping by here every once in awhile. Only a few tables in the back and there really isn't much of an ambiance as it really is a hole in the wall, so I recommend taking your meal to-go!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
Had Hawaiian Drive Inn through delivery from Waiter.com. It was delicious. The fried chicken katsu is very well seasoned and yummy. The mac salad that comes with it is also great. 

I also tried the fried shrimp and it was very crunchy, but there's really not a lot of shrimp. 

Loco Moco tastes rather salty, but still delicious. 

Portion is huge. You can order the regular lunch for $8-$9 and have it for lunch and dinner. Very reasonably priced. I would eat more often if I live close by.
author: Erni L.

description: This is the best spot in town for tasty and fast Hawaiian food. Ordered both the BBQ chicken and chicken Katsu -- good amount of rice provided. We ordered take out and the food was ready for pick up within 15 minutes. Cash only.
author: Kerry K.

description: I always  love coming to Hawaiian Drive Inn for their small chicken katsu to go. the price is major reasonable (~$5.50). The portions are huge, with at least 2 thighs, rice, and mac salad.  The large order costs a little more, but the portions enough for 2 people. Their service is fast and efficient. I usually order to-go, but when I get there, the food is still piping hot, because they cook it upon order. I haven't tried the other items yet, but will definitely give that a try. Besides the katsus, loco mocos, musubi's, and fried shrimp, they also have hamburgers and other sammy's. The location is a little sketch and dirty, but I like that a husband and wife holds down the kitchen, as long as I don't get food poisoning :)
author: Samantha W.

description:
Not the fanciest of places but they offer great affordable food and they are not stingy on their portions either. 
With a high school, middle school and various shops taquerias around is a great place to get something different for lunch at an affordable price.
You can call your order ahead of time to save on the wait, it's always pretty full during lunch hours, so be patient.
author: Luisa M.

description: They have some basic tables and chairs at the back. I ordered the chicken katsu and beef teriyaki. There was a lot of food. The katsu was crispy. The beef was tender and the sauce was well flavoured. It also came with rice and crispy cabbage. The macaroni and cheese was cold.
author: James S.

description:
I'm so happy I found this place! I planned to eat at El Farolito but we decided to stumble into this gem instead. This place is a hole in the wall establishment. The decor is dated but there was a constant flow of customers and we weren't disappointed.  After some tough deliberation, I decided to try the Katsu and BBQ Chicken along with a Spam Musubi. 

Chicken Katsu and BBQ Chicken Mini Plates were SO GOOD! The Katsu became a bit oily at the end but the BBQ Chicken was fantastic! VERY reasonably priced at $5 each. Way better than a 20 piece McNuggets!

Spam Musubi was also pretty good. I might be crazy but I think the musubi sauce was a little on the salty side. I could probably eat 3 or 4 of these bad boys with a nice guava drink. Best $2 money can buy. 

Bottom line is that this place exceeded expectations. I HIGHLY recommend making a visit here for some great food with very reasonable prices. I'll be back shortly to try their burgers and fries!
author: Chris W.

description:
Awesome in every sense of the way. Food is absolutely amazing and cheap. 
The people working there are nice and friendly. I like the katsu masubi and cheese burger because of it's bbq crisp and home made craft. 

You will keep coming back if you try it once. Truly, a hidden gem. Just go before school gets out so you can beat the crowd.
author: Phillip K.

description: This place is still good. The service is still fast and friendly. It has not changed very much at all. I like their Moco Loco platter.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
Though the name "Hawaiian Drive In" lends much more of a mental picture as far as decor is concerned (it's pretty drab inside), this place is a great lunch spot. Everything on the menu is incredibly cheap. I had a smaller BBQ chicken plate, which comes with a scoop of rice and macaroni salad. $5.30

Got it to-go, and was impressed with how filling it was. Chicken was tender and flavorful, rice was fluffy, and there was some cabbage "salad" which also added a bit of crunch. Wasn't big on the macaroni salad, next time I'll request two scoops of rice instead of the macaroni. Definitely a great way to hold over hunger.
author: Megan D.

description: This place is a total hole in the wall. When you first see it you wouldn't expect much but the food is amazing!! I loved the chicken musubi.
author: Sareen K.

description: The service is terrible. I don't care how the food tastes if your rude to your customers you need to find another occupation. Ordered my food then was told "go sit down" so we sat at one of the 4 tables. Then waited as a line grew to order food. After 10 minutes and multiple people getting served I asked about my order. "Go sit down" again. Waited 5 more minutes and left. I notice a lot of the good reviews were asian people, unfortunately I'm not so that is probably why we were not given the same level of treatment.
author: JP B.

description:
Staff is working hard.  Place is clean and prices are good for this type of food.  

Issue was the food quality and taste.  Chicken Katsu was ok but it had a piece of string like plastic.  Loco moco here was the starches, egg, a frozen hamburger patty? and gravy.  Overall the taste was better at LL and Homestyle Hawaiian in San Diego.
author: Fanshu B.

description:
The food here is really cheap and tastes really good. 

I've ordered the Katsu Mini Plate and it comes with a large portion of Katsu. 

Also, I've ordered the Spam and Fried Eggs and rice which is on their breakfast menu but is available all day. That is really good too.
author: Guorui W.

description:
First, they didn't give me the correct change!!! :( 
Ehhh I'm not a fan of the plain macaroni salad since I'm use to it "coleslaw style" with some carrots and cabbage. Plus the mayo and pasta tasted weird and artificial. The BBQ chicken was wayyyyy too salty, but I gotta say the chicken Katsu was bomb. Very unhealthy food, but it's pretty cheap and very filling.
author: Michelle F.

description: Best Hawaiian drive in in the city. Been coming here for decades and absolutely love their food! Highly recommend for anyone who loves meat and just wants some good food!!
author: Alanna K.

description: This is honestly the best Hawaiian place in SF. The food here is great and the people that work there are also amazing , not to mention it's also cheap. Can't think of a single flaw for this place
author: Slavic D.

description:
Hole-in-the-wall. Huge portions. Cheap. Tasty.

Can you get better food? Yup. For three times the money. Larger portions? Hmm. Maybe at Cheesecake Factory. Nicer ambiance? Well, yes. Probably at a few truck stops, even. But it's a four-star gig any way you slice it. Good musubi, and that's all that really matters. In the world.
author: Sean B.

description:
Well I was finally introduced to Hawaiian Drive Inn by my brother recently. How did it take me so long to finally try this hole in a wall!?

A mom and pop kind of place so don't expect anything fancy. The price in exchanged for the amount of food they offer you is great. They give you so much Chicken Katsu for $5 (mini plate) which I can barely finish. It also comes with rice and macaroni salad. It's perfect if you are in the mood for something quick but satisfying.
author: Linda H.

description: This is my go to for something close to my island food lol Love their quick service and compared to the other Hawaiian Drive Inn locations, this place serves larger portions :) Most of the day the place is real busy, but slower during the first and last business hours. Definitely economical, you can get a mini beef  and musubi for under 10 bucks!  They don't have brown rice though, in case you're looking for that. Also, street parking (meter) is tough so I recommend you going with someone or expect to park far and walk over. Everything on the menu is delicious!
author: Seutatia F.

description: I used to go this place all the time, good bbq chicken fresh right off the grill, but I stopped going after I been noticing they been grabbing cooked chicken from another plate and reheating it giving it to me.  I don't know if they were someone else's chicken, or they made extra, i don't know but they did it in a very sneaky way.  I stopped going and never went back.
author: Jordan W.

description:
I grew up in the neighborhood and still enjoy coming back around and grabbing some BBQ chicken every now and then. The place itself is small, crowded, and dirty but considering most restaurant kitchens probably have the same violations behind closed doors, I really don't care. 

Can you find better Hawaiian food elsewhere?  Well yeah, probably.  But if you're not ridiculously picky or stuck up, this place is A-OK in terms of having a decent and filling meal.
author: S C.

description: I went to a friend's house party and enjoyed some of the katsu chicken with the sweet and sour sauce. It was your standard fried chicken with a thing breaded crust. The sauce was on point with the sweet and sour flavor. Best of all it was great value for feeding a large party.
author: Tammy T.

description:
i've been coming to Hawaiian Drive Inn numero uno since high school and i still love it just as much as i do now.

i'm sure they don't have the cleanest facilities (you can just tell by walking in), but it's cheap and good and the portions are good.
author: Andy H.

description: I ordered the katsu and short rib plate for $8.75. The meal took 7 min to make. The portion of katsu was plentiful. I ate the macaroni salad which comes on a bed of thinly shredded cabbage quickly. Very refreshing. The katsu was flavorful and delicious. The short rib sauce dripped into the perfect fluffy rice and mixed into the salad. Yum. I saved the leftovers for lunch the next day and did not use the hot sauce or katsu sauce because the panko breading was perfectly crisp and chicken was well cooked. The short ribs were a bit fatty but that was expected for the price. The two cooks in the front and Cantonese speaking and seem to enjoy one another's company. It definitely looks like a hole in the wall. I would definitely come back for the great food.
author: Carina L.

description:
This place is small, dirty, sticky, hot, and cash only..

BUT they have thee best chicken katsu I've ever had! I always get the mini plate for $5 which comes with a HUGE portion of chicken katsu with sauce and a scoop of rice and macaroni salad. Definitely a bang for your buck kind of meal! 

The chicken is fried to order so you can watch the chefs fry, cut, and prepare everything right in front of you. The outcome is a very fresh crispy katsu that will satisfy your fried-food cravings :)
author: Norine L.

description: The best spot..Wayne is the man for the plan. He makes it the way I prefer and never a complaint from him. Joyce is the best, she's my to go lady.  Thanks for all the great katsu n musupis n especially well done short ribs. Yum and it's very reasonable price.
author: mami m.

description: Love this place!! Perfect place to grab a cheap and quick bite to eat. I got pretty hooked on the moco loco! I also recommend the short rib, chicken Katsu, and musubi!! They are very generous with the chicken Katsu even with the small plates.
author: Carmina D.

description:
This is possibly one of my new favoritest places ever. For those of you who know me and my penchant for Micheline meals, you may be wondering why I'm giving this place 5 stars, but the food here is DELICIOUS and it's ridiculously cheap so 5 stars. You go, Hawaiian Drive Inn.

I actually ordered them through Waiter.com for work. Their menu is simple but extensive. There are a couple of lunch plate options, stand alone items like musubis, but I went for one of the meat dishes. Depending on if you get one or two scoops of rice, the price changes, but I got a chicken katsu with one scoop of rice and one scoop of macaroni for $4.99. Where in San Francisco can you find lunch for that cheap? Correct answer: no where. I tacked on a fried egg for an additional dollar.

Portion size is HUGE. This is definitely Hawaiian comfort food at its finest. The quantity of food I got was easily enough for two meals, but it was so good I scarfed it down in half an hour. This place has some of the best chicken katsu I've ever had. I noticed that the katsu itself was a lot thinner than typical katsu where it's chicken breast meat and on the dry side. I doubt they actually used dark meat, but it definitely looked like dark meat--despite not having any sauce, the katsu was breaded perfectly, tender, and extremely flavorful. The macaroni salad as people have mentioned, is pretty darn good as well. There's nothing actually special about it, it just tastes good with the chicken katsu. I much rather would have preferred two scoops of macaroni salad than the rice, which is clumpy and pretty mediocre. But who cares if the rice is mediocre when the chicken katsu is so mindblowingly good? It's easy to have okay chicken katsu but spectacular katsu? That doesn't happen so often. 

Spam musubi was also pretty on point. They have a thin layer of sauce underneath the spam that really gives the musubi great flavor.

And can we just recap that this entire lunch was less than $8 even after tax? 

tldr; delicious food at a ridiculously cheap price! yeah it's comfort food and probably not the healthiest meal.. but who cares? it's delicious -- go for the chicken katsu!
author: Jasmine X.

description:
I love that their katsu is pretty much cooked to order. Sometimes they fry in batches, but only when it's very busy...otherwise you can be sure that it'll be prepared right in front of you. This pretty much guarantees that it's going to be succulent and perfectly crisp when you eat it. I also like that the breading is not very thick and that its a pretty hefty piece of chicken on the inside....unlike other places that serve katsu.

They do make party platters, hallelujah! I paid $25 for a small sized tray (like 9" x 11") of their katsu...called a couple days ahead and they had it ready to go, just fried when I arrived for pick-up. It was a definite hit among my friends.

Also, their macaroni salad is still hands down the best I've had.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This place used to be better, however, I watched the Chef cooking the meat and I said that's gonna make me sick. After I ate my mixed plate, I got sick with stomach pain. It's not the same meat used to be fresh. The meat is precooked and placed it back into the sauce as I saw the Chef pulled the meat out for the grill. The meat is darker. I took the meat to other people to view and it's not safe for stomach to endured such old dark meat.  I have been coming here so many years but today is the my last day.  Also, if you notice your meat is not the same as it was 5 years ago. It's lesser and piece by piece from each portion. This is a reap off of your money.  It's a cheap place with cheap food, you get what you pay for. Too bad I won't come here to pay to get sick.
author: Lil P.

description: Hawaiian Drive Inn - one of my usual go to spots whenever I'm hungry because it's cheap and in the area. I usually call in my order & pick up because it gets busy most of the time. I tend to have a big appetite and mini plates are good enough for me because portions are huge!
author: Therese F.

description:
Food here is as cheap and delicious as the plate lunches I ate growing up in Hawaii. If the people around me were to speak pidgin and wear rubber slippers, I'd think I was actually home!

The chicken katsu and BBQ chicken are great in flavor and portions. They always come out deliciously hot and fresh. The mac salad is well-seasoned. It's not smothered in mayonnaise like some people do, and the macaroni is cooked perfectly. My best friend often gets two scoops of mac salad instead of rice with his order because it's that good.

Pass on the chicken curry and lemon chicken. The "curry" for their chicken curry was essentially their gravy with extra pepper atop boiled chunks of chicken, potatoes, and carrots. The latter is a battered chicken similar to chicken katsu, minus the panko flakes that make it crispy. It's served with a container of lemon sauce reminiscent of lemonade in both taste and consistency. The zesty lemon flavor was good, but the watery consistency felt and tasted strange to eat with the chicken. It'd have been better had it been a thicker sauce or glaze.

Whenever I miss Hawaii, especially when the cold and foggy weather roll around, plate lunches from Hawaiian Drive Inn give me a deliciously comforting taste of home.
author: Tanya A.

description: I love their chicken katsu here! They give you large portions for such a good price! I always come back here when I crave chicken katsu.
author: Priscilla D.

description:
This is a restaurant that I live by! We all have those restaurants that we can always rely on and regularly get a craving for. Well, Hawaiian Drive Inn is at or near the top of that list for me! They have all the components of a great eatery! 1: The food is made to order! 2: The food is really well made! and 3: It's cheap!! For about $7 you can get a regular plate stuffed to the max with actual food. You won't get a heaping pile of cabbage like a couple other Hawaiian places I've been to. 

My normal order is the Chicken Katsu (mini plate is actually a good amount, but regular plate if I'm feeling ambitious or sharing). The breading is perfect! When you bite into each piece, you get that really crispy outer layer with juicy chicken inside. The breading doesn't fall off very often here. I understand that it's a difficult/impossible wish to have the breading always stick to the chicken, but they do a great job at Hawaiian Drive Inn. You get 1 scoop of rice with the mini plate, 2 for the regular. No matter the size plate you get, you'll receive a large scoop of delicious mac salad! This location (franchised) has better sauce (somehow) than other locations. 

Their BBQ mix plate here is pretty good. You get a good variety and pretty large amount of food, but this may be my 3rd or 4th best thing on the menu. I really like the Loco Moco. Good quality of beef patty with expertly executed eggs and a nice gravy! Yum!!!

There are a couple of other things I've had on the menu and I do want to try more, but I always give into the Chicken Katsu. Seriously...every time! I hype it up to all of my friends and never fails to amaze them! After the first bite, they're hooked!!!

They only have 4 small tables in the back, so most people take it to go. Paying for parking meters in this area sucks anyways, so take it home or to a park and enjoy the city!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
HUGE portions, but in a difficult area for parking and a little bit of a grungy/dangerous feel in the neighborhood when you want a late dinner.

Really cheap food, and a portion of small chicken katsu (less than $5) is probably meant for two! 

I wouldn't recommend eating in, but would recommend calling in and picking up an order. If you speak Cantonese, you can probably bypass some of the confusing "is that my order? Can I order?" part that you may encounter, depending on who is back there. 

Friendly service, and yummy, "good for the soul, not for the heart or thighs" food.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Simple, cheap delicious hawaiian style themed food:

A lot of different menu choices (im always a fan of teryaki steak and BBQ chicken) including their burgers which are surprisingly good (except or the BBQ chicken, doesnt make the cut).

The restaurant interior may not look like much, but what they offer in food is something that is well within your budget, comparable to the neighborhood, and tastey to keep your late night hunger away.
author: Alexander F.

description:
This place is pretty cheap for good hawaiian food. However it is cash only guys!!! They make the food you order on the spot and you can even watch them. Its really small and narrow inside and there are some tables for you to eat in but I always order mine to go. 

Theyre pretty nice about stuffing your food but not as much as Aloha. I always order to substitute the rice with more mac salad. 

Their chicken katsu is to die for. Its also fresh and the outside is so crispy while the inside is juicy and hot. Perfect combo for me when I bite and chew into it. 

Parking is easier if you park near the residentials across the street and walk over :)
author: Cuc N.

description: My favorite Hawaiin restaurant in the Excelsior District.  The were great, very professional and the food was made fast and tasted great.  For the price I paid for my Regular Chicken Katsu and BBQ shortribs was a bargain because the portions were huge.  I love their macaroni, too that comes with every dish.
author: Baoyi H.

description: I like this place.  Food comes out fast and quite tasty.  The price is very reasonable.  Seating is limited.  I really enjoy having the Loco moco.
author: Henry T.

description:
Yay for Hawaiian food near home! n__n  So, I've only just started coming here this summer but it's one of my go-to places for food nearby.  You can eat there or order to-go.  Once you walk in, you can see them making the food.

The spam musubi is good!  It's only $1.60 each!  It's hot and stays warm for a while.  They have other kinds of musubis as well.

I have had the chicken katsu mini plate and the mahi mahi fish mini plate.  The mini plates are about $4.25.  They give you a lot of chicken katsu!  The mahi mahi was good.  It was soft on the inside.  There are different sauces for the items.  The mahi mahi was in two large pieces, while the chicken katsu was cut in many pieces.  The mac and rice weren't so great.

I recommend the chicken katsu and/or spam musubi!
author: Stephanie Z.

description: The chicken Katsu is where it's at.   Close my eyes while chewing this deliciousness and I think I'm in Maui.  I wish it were closer to home.
author: Heather P.

description: Literally a hole in the wall small spot but the food is delicious. I've tried the Loco Moco (hamburger patty sunny side egg with gravy on top) Teriyaki Chicken, Chicken Katsu and Short ribs. Portion is great as well with the price.  This place is a spot you should definitely stop by while you're in the area.
author: Kevin T.

description: Heaven on earth!!  Very affordable for two people to dine and super filling.  Loco Moco is the best on the menu.
author: I'yuana P.

description:
by far the best Hawaiian food I've come across. Way better than L&L or Ono. 
I'm never disappointed and their katsu sauce is the best!
For such cheap food and huge portions this place is awesome. 
Even their burgers are DELICIOUS.
author: Kieran B.

description: I got a two meat combo with BBQ short ribs and BBQ chicken, 2 scoops of Macaroni and 1 scoop of rice. The meat was good and flavorful but the macaroni was gross (Ono's and L&L is better) and the rice was over cooked. I'd give another star but the girl that took my order was extremely rude. While I was paying for what I ordered she was focused on a side conversation with a friend or coworker that seemed to be on a break. I probably won't be coming back.
author: Robynn J.

description:
I've been coming to this place for over 5 Years now (YUP! loyal as$ customer right here!) This is without a doubt the best hawaiian fast-food in the city! 
It's a tiny hole in the wall kind of place but the service/ food quality/ portion size can't compare! 
The same family team has been manning the place for quite a while now and they know what they're doing! they have a very loyal customer base, with good reason! 
Their Chicken Katsu is all white meat not the random fatty cuts you get from the chain places! 
The portions are pretty big! (even the mini plates!) and their Spam Musubi and Loco Moco are on point too.
author: Antonio W.

description:
Serious hole in the wall, non conspicuous restaurant. It looks as if they haven't changed since they opened, and it looks like they opened in the 90's...

Warning: cash only. 

Regardless of how it looks, I really enjoyed the food!

There are tons of options to choose from, the location is small and they cook all the food as you order it, basically in front of you. There is a board above you with prices all under $10. This is good, considering it is cash only.

I ordered the chicken katsu (chicken was a little sparse) in the mini plate (one scoop of rice and one scope of mac salad). Honestly it filled me up! No complaints, especially because it was $5! It is worth your money. My friend got the short rib in the mini plate for $5 also. Amazing. 

The reason I'm not giving it a 5 star rating is because the place is definitely not the cleanest and it doesn't accept card. The best reasons to come here are because of the low prices on amazing options for Hawaiian food and they have big bottles of Sriracha!
author: Amy H.

description:
I woke up this Morning still CRAVING the food here! I'm Happy to know that I still have left overs from my Bento Box!  :)  Smiles ALL DAY!!!  Like the Hawaiian Sun Shine! 

OK Visit this Place Yo! Make the Courage and Journey to visit the Excelsior for this SPOT! Ignore Farolito next door and walk in here to have the BEST Chicken Katsu, Bento Box, Loco Moco and SPAM Musubui in your LIFE!!! 

They are Delicious! and it's Time for my Lunch! So Good Bye!
author: Alfonso C.

description: Yes, if you are hungry and want your money to go a long way then this is the place. Each plate is enough to eat half now and half later. I have only tried the katsu and teriyaki steak plates and both were satisfying. FYI, you order first, then pay when the food is ready (I stood around looking confused the first time).
author: Sam P.

description: Price is good and food is good. It's cash only. There are a lot of young ghetto people that go here too but don't let that discourage you from trying this place out. The owners are hard working.
author: Victor T.

description: Love this place! Been coming here forever. This place has been here way before all the pop up L&L & Ono joints. It's the original Hawaiian Drive in joint. So good no one comes even close!
author: Michele T.

description: Love this place! One of my favorite Hawaiian restaurant. They have large portions, reasonable price and they always deliver at a fast pace. They usually don't come with broccoli but I always order my food with it and they charge you almost nothing for it. Nice Chinese folks.
author: Angela L.

description:
*Tourist and hipsters that moved to SF STAY AWAY*

Price - $ ($10 full meal & drink)
Portions - 5 stars (1 plate is enough for 2 skinnys)
Flavors - 4 stars (bbq grill flavor, creamy Mac salad)
Service - 4 stars (order to table in 5min or less)

Better then Ono or L&L or any other wannabe..

Ive been going here since before 2pac died, and its always satisfying & delicious. This is home base.

They are very friendly here!! They have been feeding my son since he was in pre-K. Everytime i walk in, they ask about him, and even throw in an extra musubi or cheeseburger and make sure my son gets enough to eat. 

Family owned, family feel, family meal, price is cheaper then any hawaiian food joint, and portions are bigger!!  Hawaiian Drive Inn SF till death!!.... Ohh & they deliver bruh
author: Mono L.

description:
A great hole-in-the-wall place to get some Hawaiian food. It's a pretty small place with about four tables in the back of the restaurant. The people who run the place are very nice. The last time I came here was on Halloween, where they were passing out candy for kids who were trick-or-treating around the area.

Food tried so far:
-BBQ chicken (small plate): I like it! Usually I request they remove the chicken skin but they already do that for you. I asked for brown rice but unfortunately they don't serve that.
-BBQ chicken & broccoli (regular plate): Bf ordered this and he was satisfied. Plenty of broccoli and chicken, plus the mac salad and rice can fill you up.
-Chicken katsu (small plate): crispy, and cooked on the inside. Not too oily and was great as expected.

Overall: 4. Can't beat the price for Hawaiian food. The plates are delicious. CASH ONLY. One thing is that I wish they offered brown rice as an option.
author: Loriel L.

description:
Best katsu I've had so far in the bay area...breaded and fried perfectly.  Good size portions too

Skip the loco moco... they top it with a watered down gravy... more like brown water... should not put that on anything.

The teri beef is aurite.

Hawaiian Drive Inn #28 is worth coming back to...but the menu is a mine field.
Total hole in the wall...and it's CASH ONLY!!
author: Zoran L.

description: Best chicken katsu and teriyaki chicken in the city!
author: Sergio L.

description:
I can't get enough of this place. Been going here since as long as I can remember in the 90's(?). Katsu is on hit and it's not a fancy joint but it does the job!

They make your food fast! Keep in mind they only take cash!
author: Marie P.

description: Love to have lunch here! Food is good,  my kids love the teriyaki chicken,  fair price and very convenience for me to eat here with the kids after school,  only concern is the service that they need to improve little bit more,  will come back !!!
author: Shu Ting M.

description:
All my friends recommended this place to me and it was perfect since my friend and I needed take out and an extra plate for another friend. Anyways, we got there and I was faced with the most difficult decision: picking what I want. I never like ordering the same thing as my friends because I know I can just try whatever they have so it would be a waste of an experience. After strategizing for a little bit, my friend ordered a teri chicken plate, I ordered a fried shrimp and short rib seafood combo with all mac salad, and we got our friend chicken katsu with teri steak. 

Before I get into reviewing the food, I have to say how amazing the lady who took my order is because I changed my personal order like legitimately 4 times and she accomodated each time without having to write it down to get it right. First I asked to get broccoli with my dish, but turns out I couldn't. Then I asked to get no rice and she asked if I would have all mac instead and I said no, but then I changed my mind and decided I wanted all mac. Then I needed to change one of the meats because I realized I didnt want one of the ones I accidentally said. She somehow was able to get the order change everytime without writing it down and get me my exact order at the end! She was totally chill about it too, so I really appreciate that she didn't blow up at me or anything because I was REALLY needy. 

Alright so down to the food!
Teri Chicken - 8.5/10 - it was definitely not dry so that's what I look for first when I get something with chicken, I felt that it could've had a tad more sauce though

Teri steak - 9/10 - I liked this one! It was really easy to cut through even with a plastic knife because it was nice and thin. It was delicious, the teriyaki sauce wasn't as needed here as for the chicken. It wasn't tough or dry either too

Short ribs - 8/10 - I love short ribs regardless of the way it's prepared. The one's here were good, but I didn't feel that they were too spectacular. Also, the fat to meat ratio was like 1:2 which kinda sucked.. Of course you have to eat a little fat but not 1/3 of the portion..

Fried shrimp - 8.5/10 - It was fried!!! FRIED!! Anything fried is basically automatically DELICIOUS. I'm about to complain and praise the same thing right now, but there was so much of that fried shrimp that was not shrimp, just breading.. It was extremely delicious, the crunchy fried goodness where it was all breadcrumbs, but that's where I also felt it was lacking because literally only 1/2-1/3 of a piece was composed of shrimp...

Chicken katsu - 9.5/10 - definitely my favorite out of all of the one's I tried. It had the perfect chicken to fried ratio in my opinion. The coating was nice and even, until you reached the ends of course ;) the chicken was also super juicey. I felt that you definitely could've eaten it all without the katsu sauce but with it, it was just even more delicious. 

Mac salad - 8/10 - good, not great, tasted a little bland but could've been because I was scarfing down all this meat at the same time hahahaha 


Overall, I definitely would come back for some take out and maybe try some other things on their menu. I saw that musubi was only 1.70 each! Hawaiian Drive Inn will fulfill your appetite completely because they don't mess with their portions. They give well more than you need and all for a really reasonable price. Service is good also, but just be prepared to hold your hunger in when you wait for your food because the smell is intoxicating in there!
author: Holly P.

description:
Eeek one of my favorite hole-in-the-wall places in SF!

I came here a lot when school let out and in-between volleyball game practices and breaks for a quick bite with friends and teammates. Quality of food is excellent and portions are a good size for the price. I LOVE their spam musubi. They also have katsu, bbq chicken and portuguese sausage musubi but I stick to the classic yet delicious spam for $1.60. I also love getting their bbq chicken and katsu mini plates. For $4 and something cents, you can get a small yet filling amount of food. I can never finish one mini plate in one sitting. I have also tried their spam saimin a few years ago. It wasn't bad either, but it seemed really simple to make (it's just spam pieces, noodles and soup. Nothing fancy.)

I feel like with the amount of money they make, they could spice up the place a little to make it more customer-friendly. They could probably use a fresh paint job and a less jankier, less graffitied bathroom. Everytime I have to use their bathroom I feel like I'm in some alleyway about to get robbed haha. It's kinda cool how you can watch them make your food though, and when you leave you'll be rocking their mouthwatering hawaiian food scent.

Oh and did I mention the owner is REALLY nice?! He gives you freebies if you try chatting it up with him (bonus: if you speak chinese!) Or smile and say hello each time (because I don't speak chinese hahah) if you are a regular. I got a free hawaiian sun today from him and free fries before. :)
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Outer Mission is not a neighborhood frequented by many who don't live in its direct vicinity. Hell, I'm over in Ingleside and I find that I barely make my way over to this stretch of Mission st. However, I will say that if you're the kind of San Franciscan or tourist who thinks that the city limits are confined to downtown, nob hill, mission, and and SoMa, you're going to miss out on some great eats.

Hawaiian Drive Inn is one of those cozy hole-in-the-walls you'll find along the southern stretch of Mission. Run by what appears to be the entire family (sometimes you'll find the kids running around), this establishments serves up some fine deep-fried and grilled Hawaiian fare that blows away chains like Ono and L&L. My personal favorite dish here is the loco moco. Cheap prices and generous portions. You will get TWO hamburger patties with TWO eggs and lots of rice and mac salad. It is possible to partition this one meal into two. 

Skip on dining in. The restaurant itself seems a bit dirty and the floors and tables sticky.
author: Dan K.

description:
Prices are great and the food is exceptional! My favorite is the chicken katsu which I usually don't go for because of all the breading, but the taste is much better than other places I usually go to. Just make sure to open the container up a little or poke a few holes because the steam does tend to make the chicken soggy.

The burgers are good, but when the cook cooks the burger on the grill with a lot of other food cooking on the flattop, the burger tends to have a teriyaki flavor to it because of all the marinade that comes in contact from the meat on the grill.

I usually take to-go here so I'm just going to base it on that. This place satisfies any munchies craving!
author: George Z.

description:
Low prices, greasy, heavy portions, and made to order.  This place is a real dive.  Taste wise, the short-ribs and katsu were a 3.5.  But the low prices and beefy portions kick it up.  Service is meh, and pick-up orders go something like this:
1. you wait
2. wonder what to do
3. order
4. wait, wait
5. wait, wonder if that's your order
6. wait, wait, pick up your order
7. pay.
The numerical steps probably exaggerate the wait time.  But I remember waiting a bit since there was a line.  I was also two-timing, by bouncing between this place and the vietnamese sandwiches next door, wondering which order would finish first.  That sounds so slutty, but I was horngry--err, I mean hungry.
author: Diane N.

description:
Lunch was $5 and damn was it good. For $5 you get BBQ chicken, rice and a macaroni salad. Healthy? No. Tasty? Hell yeah.

Avoid it after 3ish when Balboa high students get out because it will be PACKED.
author: Carlos A.

description: Excellent food and service is usually quick. Awesome costumer service sometimes I don't have enough money on me and they say next time. Very friendly too.
author: David B.

description:
Chicken teriyaki and short ribs combo is so tasty.
Wish they are closer to my work, so I could go more often.
Good price for good quality food.

The lady is really friendly.
author: Che K.

description: Small place in the excelsior district. This place has been around for a long time. Even though its not the best looking place, their food are good and reasonable price. Last time i came here, i got the combo plate of bbq chicken and bbq steak for about $8.30 or more. Not bad. Good amount of food. Decent flavor to the meat. The other time, i got the mushubi for 1.70. This mushubi was only alright. When i brought it home to eat, it was a bit salty and a little bit too sweet. And it breaks really easily. Depend on how busy it is, you may have to wait any where from 10-15 minutes or more to get your food. You can eat in but limited place to eat in so its best to take it to go.
author: Julie N.

description: I love this place! I like it that they cook it fresh and their food is really good and cheap ! You may have to wait for a few minutes but it's worth the wait! The place is just a little small for when eating on some days.
author: Kristofer P.

description: I absolutely love their chicken katsu. It's cooked perfectly and the portion sizes are huge.  A mini plate is perfect for 1 person. Everything I have tried here is great.
author: Kody S.

description:
As sketchy as this place looks and feel I admittingly like their food!!

Their katsu is as good as katsu gets fried crispy and holds the crisp for at least the car ride home, they also do their katsu a la carte which is mad bonus points for me because it lets me get another dish awith friecd chicken as a side!!

Their loco moco was in line with any Hawaiian restaurant I've been to in California egg cooked perfect, gravy not too shabby, decent amount of burger.

They lose a star for the creepy bastard who came in asking for money that they just let wander around inside. It shouldn't be my problem as a customer to deal with their neighborhood inside their establishment.

Also bonus points for delivery that I haven't tried yet.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Their chicken Katsu was very fresh and the lady packs it! ;) Spam masubi was great. Their French fries has a good texture. Overall a great Hawaiian food place to stop and eat! 

Would be awesome if they would extended their hours a little later though.
author: David M.

description:
Really good food Really good prices and its a local owned business! looks a little run down inside but the grill master definitely knows whats he's doing! 
Tip: Do Take-out
author: Ulysses R.

description:
Like everyone says....yeah this place does look a bit sketchy from the outside but you know what they say- DON'T JUDGE A BOOK BY IT'S COVER!

Cause damn, they make some good food. I usually get chicken musubi, chicken katsu, BBQ chicken, or the moco loco. And oh my gudness.......is it good. I always come here when I'm in for a "meaty" fix as weird as that sounds. The lady at the register is really nice and service is not bad for such a small place. 

DaKine's cannot compare.
author: Marny N.

description:
Ight so this is an update from my last review. Just got around to trying the Loco Moco. My thoughts:

- Seriously two patties and two eggs. I'm so on board. Portion could have fed two.

- Patties were delicious. Eggs and gravy were delicious. Lots of rice (I normally go no mac salad).

-$6.50 ... stupid cheap.

Very happy gonna get me some again soon!
author: Tom L.

description: Chicken katsu is good. First time trying Hawaiian food and satisfied with the result.
author: Linh C.

description:
Got a Medium Party Platter for Chicken Katsu.

It was a heaping pile of food that was well worth the $40.

I would definitely come here again.
author: Steven F.

description:
Forget ever going to L&L Hawaiian again. If you are in the area, just come here instead. 

The loco moco here is absolutely fantastic: beef was soft, tender and succulent. The gravy and egg topped over it were just perfect. The large size comes with 2 scoops of rice and mac salad for just $7 (cash only). 

The chicken katsu was nicely crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. It was not oily to the point where one would have to use paper towel to soak it up. The sauce was delightfully tangy and sweet.  

This is more of a to-go place, but if you want you can always dine in. I do not enjoy it, because the decor and surroundings look unkept and dirty. But honestly, this review is about food, right?
author: Christopher N.

description:
This place is a little hidden gem on Geneva. If you are in the mood for some Chicken Katsu, trust me this place is the one to go to. The service here can get pretty crowded at peak times. I would recommend giving yourself plenty of time to wait (at least 15-20 min) for your order to be ready. Usually I only see two people running the entire place so patience is a must.

Once you get your food though, the lady at the front gives you a very good portion of Katsu weather you get a regular or a double meat plate. This place always makes me pretty full after eating everything. Besides from giving you so much, the food actually tastes great. 

The macaroni they give you on the side I'd give a 2/5, it's not the best tasting but it's eatable lol. The rice is the same taste as any other place, but the chicken Katsu is in my opinion a 5/5! Yum!

I highly recommend coming here at least once if you're around the area!
author: Alex D.

description:
One word: Mmmmmm.

I love every item on their menu! 

Three drawbacks: There aren't many tables to sit and dine in. You basically have to walk outside to walk to the bathroom.  It's not wheelchair acessible! 

Based on the food and the friendly couple that is always working I would give five stars but I'm taking away a star because people in wheelchairs are screwed.
author: Alicia S.

description: They've got the best spam musubi. They prepare their's with an extra step of grilling. There are several choices in the nearby area and I hold out for Hawaiian Drive Inn.
author: Marie L.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Hawaiian BBQ. One day, I was walking home from getting some groceries and I came across this place. It looked pretty sketchy from outside, so naturally I referred to Yelp to do an initial screening. I ended up ordering Loco Moco and a spam musubi on my first visit. I wasn't disappointed at all. Both dishes were amazing.

I came back yesterday for the curry mixed plate and loved it. I'm definitely going to come back here pretty often.

The only downside I could think of is that this place is cash only. But I guess that's why it's pretty cheap. And maybe the macaroni salad could be just a little bit more flavorful.
author: Harry G.

description: Best Hawaiian in the city. If you want the yummy grindz, come here!!!
author: Jane S.

description: I usually come here and there is no problems,  but tonight I called and ordered 10 minutes ahead thinking it should be enough time to pick up only 2 plates that they always have more than enough cooked.. a chicken katsu, and chicken teriyaki,  they made me wait another 20 minutes and served everyone else but me... I kept my cool because my son was hungry,  because if it were up to me, I would have left the food and never to return.. ridiculous
author: Jamie M.

description:
((( HUGE ))) proportions of food! You will get more than your money's worth when you order from here. 
Don't expect to find any parking either. This hole is a great place to fulfill your starvation.
author: Shaun R.

description:
This place gets zero stars for complete, utter lack of sanitation practices and disgusting tasting food.  Don't trust the reviews.  The only reason this place has a decent trend is because it's cheap.  The workers don't wash their hands after returning from break and they don't wash their hands after they touch money and then go touch food.  No one is wearing gloves.  They touch cooked food after they touch raw food and on top of that the lady at the register can't take orders.  

The food is flavorless, mushy, and burnt.

If you don't get diarrhea immediately upon consuming the food from here then you have a stomach of steel and will probably do very well in the zombie apocalypse.  :)

This place deserves as many zero star reviews as it gets.  Please stop defending this cesspool.
author: Amber R.

description:
This place isn't bad, pretty good hawaiian food when you're craving it for a decent price.

Chicken Katsu - they give you a hefty portion of katsu, you won't think you should've gotten more. The mini size already gives you a lot, and it's enough to fill me up.

Loco Moco - the patty is kinda overcooked so it's slightly dry, but it's still not too bad. They drench it in gravy so it balances it out
author: Harriet W.

description: This is most definitely the best and pretty decently priced Hawaiian BBQ place in SF. It's small and there are barely any tables to sit in but most definitely worth taking the food to-go
author: Jacob J.

description: The food is bomb and a really good deal. This place is definitely lacking ambience and isn't too big but the portions are huge and they cook to order.
author: Laticia L.

description: This place takes forever. The food could be good but the place looks horrible. They give no receipts. I would understand if the food was cheap but it's not. It's the price as any other food place
author: Marc S.

description:
We've always been a long time customer, but lately it has seems as if they are skimping on the quality and amount of their food....all while raising their prices. 

My kids love the Chicken Katsu but the last few orders haven't been the same. There has been so much more batter than actual chicken in their plates.
author: Just Meeh B.

description: The food was very nasty. The Mac and cheese has weird icky flavor. The sauce on the chicken was very odd. I'm pretty sure most people will like it but I don't. Hawaiian good to me is Chinese food that is Americanized and I don't like Chinese food
author: Samuel B.

description: The only place I go to out of all the hawaiian drive inn/LL's/ whatever other place in the area, this is the best one ... MASUBI'S are on point here! Cash only... so be prepared
author: Corey G.

description: It was ok not the usual hawaiian barbecue that I'm use to else where. Went there with a co worker he also agree we not come to this one of we're craving hawaiian BBQ
author: LaVonda S.

description: Yes, this place is a hole in the wall dump. Yes this place has the nastiest graffiti bathroom. Yes this place is F'n delicious with great prices!! bbq chicken and beef are delicious. Saimin soup is also one of my favorites. This is always my go to spot when in the Excelsior
author: Andrew V.

description:
LOCO MOCO!!!! I have had other things here but this is the best thing on their menu. Just something about a hamburger patty cooked on a well seasoned flat top. So Amazing. 

So here is a breakdown...rice, with 2 hambrger patties on top, with 2 fried egg, smothered in gravey, and macaroni salad. HOLY SH#T BATMAN!! Nirvana, pure nirvana. 

Cash only, but its cool because this huge plate of food that I cannot finish is only $6.50!!
author: Lizzie D.

description:
Update since I finally tried it , 

The Musubi ,,, I really like this which is sort of weird ! 

You get the Fish Flavor From the Wrap, The Weight From the Rice , and For Me The Decadent Center Which Was Spam  ,, I never eat Spam , BUT would in this instance.

I think is a little pricey per piece , BUT , is as far a price as I have seen given what others are charging per piece. I think about $1.80 , 

As a treat and something different it was worth it ,  

The space could use a lot of work, but then again I used to enjoy Sam Wo when it was still in operation .
author: Joseph A.

description: It's a little hole in the wall. It seems like the food is not going to be good at all but it's the complete opposite. It is cheap and good. They serve big portions. And for the price their katsu chicken is one of the best on mission. .This is the spot to go when you are hungry and on a budget
author: Hershey R.

description: Proof positive that yelp rankings aren't infallible.
author: Amy C.

description:
Cheap but huge portions. Cash only.

Truth be told, the food actually sucks. It's nothing good, nor is it horribly disgusting. I ordered the loco moco and a spam musubi for under $10. I couldn't finish the whole thing for two reasons: 1) I got a lot of food, 2) It didn't taste good enough to finish.

I'd probably never return, but if you're in the area and looking for cheap, might as well give this place a shot.
author: Paul B.

description: I cannot believe this place is still open! :) Hawaiian Drive Inn #28 is the reason why I love short ribs :) When I was younger, I remember my mom and dad always bringing home short ribs from this place. Their short ribs are perfect and they are always generous with their portions which is definitely a plus! Ah, I might need to visit this place again sometime soon. :)
author: Joyce E.

description: Ew.  They keep their breaded chicken katsu in an uncovered cardboard box in the fridge.  Their bathroom is tagged with graffiti and feels extremely dirty.  I guess all the good food is dirty ;) Yum
author: Victor L.

description:
If you don't mind a longer drive, I would recommend getting your Hawaiian fix at Hawaiian Drive Inn #28 over L&L.

First off, their prices are cheaper and the portions are larger. Their offer a variety of masubis (Spam, Chicken Katsu, Portuguese Sausage, and BBQ Chicken) which are only $1.50! 

The overall quality of food is much better than L&L's.

Customer service has been consistently friendly which is great!
author: Juliette R.

description:
The only good thing I can say is it's really really cheap. But they fill your plate with white rice and greasy macaroni salad so it's not even that much of a deal (you can make rice & macaroni much cheaper at home).

The worst part about this place is they only use plastic & styrofoam to serve food, even if you eat at a table. So not only are they breaking San Francisco law, but they're causing MOUNTAINS of trash and even putting you at higher risk for cancer (see http://www.sfenvironment.org/article/prevent-waste/food-service-waste-reduction-ordinance ).

Tell them to cut out the styrofoam!
author: Geae D.

description: Big portions and they deliver too!! Best chicken katsu in the mission. I orders 4 meals for delivery on the weekend and it got to mecin less than 45 minutes. The delivery person was also really friendly and pleasant. The only downside is eating in. The place gets cramped sometimes but if you order take out or delivery its just amazing. The musibis are so tasty!!! Mmm
author: John W.

description:
I was a little hesitant at trying this place out b/c I can't stand eating at L & L's (the only other hawaiian bbq place I've been)... but I really enjoyed my lunch here!
