I ordered the Mini Chicken Katsu and it was more than enough. I really wanted to try some of their Musubis mmm... next time. The chicken was fried well but was also juice inside and not dry! They made the katsu after I ordered so I knew it was fresh and not just picked out of a pile of katsu underneath a heat lamp.

The lady kept apologizing for the dirty table but I kept telling her it was fine... I noticed that there were remnants of the krispies all over the table. It seems like the katsu is popular here.
author: Yumi H.

description:
We drove by this place the other day. Me and my husband love Hawaiian food and decided to check it put we we absolutely loved it. Big portions (next time ill order the mini chicken Katsu, cuz I could finish the regular size). The people there where really nice and working fast. The lady at the counter remembered all the orders in her head and even gave us extra gravy when we asked for it. 
We'll definitely come back, or at least order cuz they deliver too :)
author: Jacky J.

description:
The best Hawaiian BBQ I've ever been to, hands down.  I've been other places, even ones that donned the same name, and they just don't come close.  
Definitely a hole in the wall, so expect just that.  But if you can get past the dingy decor then you're in for a real treat!  
Everything is freshly made to order, and in large portions.
author: Catrina C.

description: I was so mad when they told me they couldn't deliver when I live less than 10 minutes away- plus they gave my mom food poisoning. Food was so-so but they were rude as well.
author: Arianne N.

description: This is what hawaii plate lunch tastes like.  Simple, cheap, and made to order.  The prices are great and the restaurant is clean enough to where you would eat inside.  I wasn't a fan of the katsu sauce and my only recommendation is to bring your own water.  Unless you get the Hawaiian Sun, then it's all good.
author: Kelvin W.

description:
Great food. Good price.

I can't believe I never wrote a review for this place. Hawaiian Drive Inn is only a few blocks from my house and I usually stop by here after going to the Post Office. 

Walk in. Order. Watch them make it. Grub.

I usually order the regular ribs which comes with two scoops of rice, one scoop of mac salad and about 4 pieces of ribs. I wish they gave more of the lettuce that's on the bottom of the rice - I love it when the sauce from the ribs drip down to the rice and lettuce. Their spam musubi is also a must try. Expect a 10 minute wait if you just walk in.
author: Joanna W.

description:
Hawaiian Drive Inn #28 is an excellent option for a hearty meal that your brain urges to save half of but your stomach tempts you to finish and always wins.

The chicken katsu was fried to a golden crisp, somehow retaining a minimal amount of grease and the maximum amount of flavor.  The bbq chicken was also infused with substantial seasoning that was heightened after being slathered in the provided sauce.  The double scoop of rice was the perfect amount to soak up the sauciness of the meal.  However, the macaroni salad's dressing tasted watered down, and did not have the sticky consistency that is evidence of a rich dressing.  

Hawaiian Drive Inn is worth the inevitable post-meal lethargy if you are in the area!
author: Andrew M.

description: My kids love the fish sandwich and hamburgers here. They also give lots of fries. It's an alternative to IN N OUT Burger. The owners are very nice and service is fast!
author: Anna K.

description: All I can say is wow, how do you screw up Loco Moco? I've been eating Loco Moco since I was 4.  I didn't know what Japanese rice with a hamburger patty, a Maggi seasoned gravy and a soft yolk was called until  I arrived in Hawaii years ago.  Nowadays a fatty meal like that happens only every so often.  Hawaiian Drive In on Mission St SF was the worst meal we've had in a while.  Minute type rice does not belong in anything loosely Asian related, macaroni salad was bland and tasted spoiled. The patty was mushy, not expecting steak obviously but not a consistency of cow jello either.  The BBQ platter was not half as good as L&L's. I'd give L&L's 3 stars.  Lastly, the place needs a cleaning team's makeover and a verbal beat down from Chef Gordon Ramsey.  A glass of plop plop fizz fizz was dessert...
author: Yumm Y.

description:
Loco moco

What else is there to order! Its a hole in the wall joint

Well worth the visit and will continue to come back.

Parking can be a hassle

Service is very friendly and nice
author: Michael m.

description: Very disappointed by this place.  I'm from the islands and just moved to Glen Park, so I was super excited to try this place since its just a short drive away.  Tried a few standbys, and the chicken Katsu was the only thing that is worth coming back for...the only reason this place gets 3 stars overall and not 1.  The Katsu by itself is probably 4 stars.  Everything else -- loco moco, musubi -- was in between meh and bad.
author: j k.

description: This little hole in the wall is delicious and for a good price!! For under 7 bucks you can have Lunch and Dinner!!! Chicken Katsu is super crispy and they give you 2 breasts!
author: Taylor H.

description:
I've been hitting this spot up for quite sometime. Hands down one of the best chicken katsu around! 
I've been to L&L and other wanna be HDI but they really don't compare to this place. Portions are generous and prices aren't bad. Watch out though cause sometimes you end up smelling like whatever food that's cooking!
author: Anna P.

description:
We came here looking for a place that could cater the Hawaiian food for my birthday/ugly Hawaiian shirt party.

*Cue the sad trombone*

The food was sad.  The place was dingy (beyond the neat hole-in-the-wall variety of dingy).  The meat was all greasy and fatty (cheap).  I don't even think the rice was decent.  WHO SCREWS UP WHITE RICE?

This place was so disappointing that we opted for L&L catering.  Think about that...  WE OPTED FOR L&L.
author: Patrick C.

description: Hawaiian greasy spoon plate lunch.  Reminds me of Kenny's, Rainbow, Byron's, Hungry Lion (20 years ago), and Likelike (back in the day).  Descent prices, big portions.  Nothing amazing,...but you know what you're gonna get.
author: Alexander H.

description: This is my favorite local spot for authentic Chicken Katsu and BBQ !! The burger special is the best in town, how can you beat a double cheeseburger with large fries and a drink for 5$?! The line is always long for this place but they get things out fast.
author: Siobhan R.

description:
Awesome Food, Super Cheap, Quick Good Service.

Chicken Katsu is amazing, greasy and delicious.
Spam Masubi is cheap and a perfect snack
Portuguese sausage Masubi is also amazing

All the food is yummy and cheap. Did I mention it was cheap? Also the portions are super big, they really dont screw you on serving sizes.

Synopsis: Amazing food, large portions, super cheap, and super fast
author: Peter A.

description: Love this place. The price is so reasonable and they stack the meats well. The food is really good.
author: Linh V.

description:
"How many bullets left in thees gun, Cheeno? Enough to keel you?...or you?...or YOU?"

OK, I didn't really hear that at the Hawaiian Drive-In. That was actually Natalie Wood's last speech in "West Side Story", but it does seem a tad dicey on this part of Mission. And OK, the young customers - all male - weren't wielding switchblades....just cell phones. And head bandanas are so Rhoda. Gee, maybe I really was in the Castro. And nobody said "Daddio" or "Cool" or "We're gonna have a rumble tonight". Too bad because I know the words to "Gee, Officer Krupke!".

In my unending search for the perfect saimin in San Francisco, I decided to try this place and ordered the Aloha Saimin. Not bad, especially for $4.50, but nowhere near Hawaii-level sorry to report.  They were generous with the meat toppings - chicken and steak teriyaki slices and a fried egg on top. And actually the broth was not too salty either. But the noodles - the true deal breaker - were not up to snuff. They tasted a bit better than ramen noodles and were far too skinny to pass for saimin.

My friend ordered the far more robust Teriyaki Mix Plate for $5.95, where he got a generous portions of the chicken and steak teriyaki as well as a couple of Korean-cut short ribs, all on top of a mound of rice and surrounded by another pile of macaroni salad and cabbage confetti. It was good and hearty though the macaroni concoction was rather bland. One point does have to be deducted for the open bucket of raw meat within viewing distance of the counter. Hide it, will ya?

It's really more like a lunch counter. There are only four little tables in the back, but everything is lit up like a Wal-Mart. Oddly, you actually don't pay when you order but when you leave. In fact, the owner actually brings the food to you at the table. Great prices for a lot of hearty food...whether you are a Jet or a Shark.

FOOD - 3.5 stars...hearty fare, middling saimin
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...no luau here
SERVICE - 4 stars...points for unexpected table service
TOTAL - 3 stars...there's a place for us...somewhere a place for us
author: Ed U.

description: I've been coming here for years,probably the only person that tips you and you're gonna bitch at me for asking you for extra Siracha after I ordered for 3 people? WTH!!!!!!!!! Stingy as f*ck!!!!! Food is still bomb though
author: Betsy E.

description: This place is so good I love their masubi I think that's how u spell it they  are so good everything from their is good and the lady is so nice to you and it's small but they make good food at its cheap but only cash only that sucks for people that have credit card
author: Rosalind B.

description: Mini Katsu plate for $6.50? Goodbye New Year's Resolution!
author: Koa O.

description:
Dirty looks = great food at great prices, at least in this case. Place is a bit sketchy looking but i first went there years ago, when i was in high school across the street , i could care less about how the place looked.

I kinda liked "secret bathroom" its like an urban art gallery filled with graffiti in every imaginable place lol


I tried everything on the menu but stick to the bbq chicken and katsu. Every now an then when im real hungry i wil opt for the bbq mix plate. Full size plates are enough for 2 meals. Mini is good for one meal if you are feeling extra hungry

Food = 10
Service = 10

Consider the seats and tables as an extra not part of what you pay for, they give you alot of delicious food to make up for the looks of the place which is what i prefer anyways.
author: Yosof R.

description: GOOD HOOD EATS. I come here pretty regularly when I'm too busy to cook. Shoutout to the workers for being FAST and being open everyday of the week. A mini plate will suffice for one person, (I EAT ALOT), but I get the regular plate to satisfy two meals for the day. Katsu musubi, katsu plate is on point. I hope they switch out of styrofoam takeout boxes in the future though.
author: Jamie P.

description:
I thought I'd see big Samoans or something, but turned out to be greeted by friendly Asians! I think.

They're always super nice and take your order right away. I never sit down inside, since I live really close and want take-out instead. The 10-minute walk back home, I can smell the chicken katsu and my nostrils are having the time of their lives.

The chicken katsu mini plate: less than $5, HELLA CHICKEN KATSU, a plop of macaroni salad and rice. The reason why I get the mini plate is because the amount of meat they give you is outrageously ginormous. And the rice portion is the smallest possible, which is good because their rice is gross. Maybe it's good to some people, but I have rice everyday and it's not made with that much water.

I recommend this place! You can see them cook it right in front of you, and it always takes less than 10 minutes from the time you order. The difference between the mini plates and the bigger ones is the amount of rice and salad you get, so opt for the mini plate for the meat!
author: Karen L.

description: I always come here to get my Hawaiian food fix. I normally order their chicken katsu mini plate with a spam musubi, but I've also tried their BBQ short ribs. Their chicken katsu is super crunchy and juicy plus they give HUGE portions even for a mini plate. Their macaroni salad is a bit bland, but other than that I have no complaints. Workers are friendly too; they acknowledge you right when you walk in. LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Genie Y.

description: Okay... this is a real hole in the wall so if you blink you will miss it. Hawaiian Drive has thee BEST chicken katsu and BBQ plates hands down. I had really good Hawaiian BBQ from all over San Francisco but it gets no better than this. Everything is fresh you get  tons of food for a pretty inexpensive amount and the service is fast.. I love this Family business!!
author: A. C.

description: The masubi here is a staple in my weekly things to eat. The price is great and feeds a lot of people no matter what you order. The location is conveniently. Located next to the 14 bus stop.
author: Julius J.

description:
Big portions!! everything is always made to order. The chicken katsu or the bbq chicken are my togo food. 

Just be careful when you order for delivery.. And comfirm everything
author: J W.

description: Food potions are huge & very tasty. Price is terrific, decor needs updating but then they'd have to charge more.:-):-):-):-)
author: Deborah B.

description: Great taste, big portions and cheap even when they raised the price! I get teriyaki mix plate or chicken katsu where they give you 2 big pieces for $6. Place is good to cure that Hawaiian food fix. Better and cheaper than L&L
author: Ryan L.

description: Love everything about this place. Don't care if its not the best I've had but damn it's good. The chicken Katsu is amazing & the BBQ chicken is juicy, the spam musubi is on point. Literally go in order what your heart desires and you will not be let down. I love the convenience of this spot and it gives you an option besides for a taqueria on mission street. My usual is the BBQ Mini plate with rice and macaroni, it always leaves me full and usually I cant even finish it. Hands down on my top spots to grab a cheap bite in the city.
author: Leah C.

description:
Flashback: My Jansport backpack thumps heavily, repeatedly on my back as I run to catch the bus. I run as fast as my Air Max's will let me. I jump onto the bus just in the nick of time, juggling an open Hawaiian Sun can, my FastPass & a plastic bag; in it a styrofoam container of Hawaiian Drive Inn grub to ease my after-school hunger for when I got home. Teenagers get very hungry!

I know. I KNOW there are Yelpers like me who grew up in the Excelsior that remember this exact scenario. That's some back in the day stuff!

I'm reviewing Hawaiian Drive Inn because I just had some at my cousin's house for our father's day get together. I never know specifically what kind of food they'll have on the table, but it's always guaranteed to be something I am familiar with since they still live in my old 'hood. I grabbed a plate & loaded up on sticky white rice, macaroni salad & chicken katsu & reminisced about eating this food 2-3 times a week during my teenage years (*cue Pharcyde's "Passing Me By"*) 

I prefer Hawaiian Drive Inn to all the other "plate lunch" joints (L&L, Ono Hawaiian, etc.)
author: Fancypants X.

description: I've never written a review, but I used to come here a lot in middle school when I lived in the Excelsior. I've come back a few times here and there because I have this one memory I'm particularly fond of. They don't take card, and I didn't have any cash at the time. Bank of America was only a block or two away but they told me it was alright, gave me my meal for free, and told me to just pay them back next time.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Hawaiian Drive Inn has been my best friend and ally when I'm what SF-ers would say "hella" broke. Where else can you get a yummy meal for under $5 that hasn't been sitting out under heat lamps? No, that was a rhetorical question, don't answer it :) 

I usually get the barbeque chicken mini plate, or the chicken katsu (crispy chicken strips with dipping sauce). Besides meat, the plates also come with rice and macaroni salad. The regular plates have one extra scoop of rice and slightly more meat than the mini plates. 

This particular location delivers, and they also have a frequent buyer card that you fill up with stamps for a free meal. Minimum purchase is $15, which is sort of difficult to reach considering the food is so cheap. You can also call in your order and it's ready in less than 10 minutes. 

Wow. I know entirely too many details about food places. I eat out too much. But that's also why you should listen to me :)
author: Mariela D.

description:
Okay, hole in the wall.. grimy kind of looking place with limited seating BUT do not let that discourage you.  I have never gotten sick from their food and its always well cooked.  

Delicious BBQ chicken, short ribs, chicken katsu (love!) and yummy macaroni salad.

When I'm craving hawaiian bbq, this is THE spot I come to.  Just a few blocks from my house within walking distance.  Only problem is they close early at 9pm, so no late night munching.
author: Lisa T.

description: Best Hawaiian Drive Inn thus far! They were friendly, polite and they have great size plates!
author: Chante L.

description: I have been getting Hawaiian drive inn for lunch and its been better. I feel bad for them at lunch time though because they have a lot of high school students coming in and its pretty packed now. it used to be very calm, but its very crowded now around 3-4pm.
author: Samantha N.

description:
Great Hawaiian food. Great Price. And fast customer service.

You wont see it when you drive by because its so small and squeezed between restaurants.

Place is small and looks dirty, but food is totally opposite of its physical image. Hole in the wall classic. 

Potion are generous. And I meant it because I can eat alot.

Hawaiian food are not the healthiest but I am sure you didnt come here for healthy food.
author: U L.

description: The first place I tried short ribs! Love it! WIll always remember that moment!
author: Rene R.

description:
Very cheap and very satisfying, big portioned Hawaiian food. Big loco moco patties with eggs steaming on top, BBQ chicken that is soft and tender to the touch, and man-sized scoops of macaroni.

Any full dish is enough to fill me up, and I don't fill easy. If I can do that for $7, I figure I just got a hookup.  I just wish they weren't cash only or I would go much more often.
author: Jared S.

description:
Depending on the time of day... orders can get backed up. I usually call in 15 minutes prior to arriving. They have i love love love their Teriyaki Chicken/Katsu! They always hook it up with the portions! 

LOVE IT!
author: Catalina F.

description:
I love this place. I used to walk there to get mini plate in middle school.  since i moved i can't go often, but my sis still wants me to go there and get something for her.
I always get the chicken katsu for my sis and maui maui mini plate for me. I like both of them a lot. The lady is so nice. She always put so much meat in the mini plate. And this place is so cheap. It is the cheapest place around.  

RECOMMEND IT!
author: Lily L.

description: You know how some people try to cash in on Hawaiian food lovers and they do it all wrong? Well, this place got it right in every way imaginable! I was floating around in the mission, looking for a bite to eat, and I came across this place. I used the Monicle feature on my app and it became apparent to me that this place served some exceptional bites at a dirt cheap price. Just the smell alone seized me by the wallet, so I walked in and ordered a double BBQ cheeseburger, a chicken katsu sushi roll and a small serving of fries. And from there, I realized that I had stumbled upon a neighborhood gem. The burger patties were perfectly charred and the sauce, the sauce was mesmerizingly delicious. The chicken katsu sushi roll had great flavor to it and the fries were, well just fries. 5/5 stars I am coming back soon (no really)!
author: Richard L.

description: If you enjoy Hawaiian barbecue, then you should definitely try Hawaiian Drive Inn on Mission Street! Being from the 808 State, us kama'aina would know good island grinds when we taste it, and this place definitely has the goods! The menu is not as extensive as you would expect from a Hawaiian barbecue restaurant, but they still have a great selection of your local favorites. I ordered the mini hamburger steak plate and it came with two hamburger patties along with a scoop of rice and mac salad. My hamburger steak plate was delicious, but what put it over the top for me was the thick, flavorful gravy smothering it! It was pretty much just like hamburger steak I have often enjoyed back home on Oahu! My girlfriend's mini mahi-mahi plate looked good and she ate most of it. Our friend's mini barbecue short ribs plate looked scrumptious and she enjoyed her meal as well. This place might not be in the best location or have the nicest interior, but don't let that deter you from trying out their excellent cuisine. Service is very friendly and welcoming, interior is clean and bright, and prices are very reasonable. I would definitely come back to try out the rest of their menu. Bonus points for having a restroom for their customers. Mahalo to our friend for recommending Hawaiian Drive Inn to us!
author: Kevin Y.

description: Great hawaiian food (may not be authentic), but it is quite tastey and the prices are really cheap! I got the chicken katsu and the barbeque chicken mini plates and they were both legit! They give you so much meat! The mini plates are such a good deal cause it is just one less rice scoop, but you shave off like $2 from the regular plates. WOOOOH!
author: Kevin L.

description:
It really bothers me that this is what Hawaiian food in the bay area has been reduced to. Don't get me wrong - I love a good plate lunch, but this place is not that.

The BBQ is super greasy, low quality cuts of meat that have been hanging out in teri/shoyu sauce for who knows how long. The Ribs themselves are chock full of tendons and gristle and my beef was colored a weird shade of blue.

Tried the Katsu, and it was pretty gnarly. Super greasy/oily and didn't really taste too much like chicken.

Hawaiian Drive Inn 28: Plate Lunches as Mcdonald's: Hamburgers. Avoid.
author: Owen R.

description:
Really good and cheap! The mini plates are the only ones I get when I eat by myself because they give so much meat already! It's probably just less rice anyways. Their BBQ Chicken and Katsu Chicken are both good. Macaroni salad is delicious too. I love coming here for cheap eats!

It looks dirty and sketchy from outside, but it's good, so I'm not complaining!
author: Diana L.

description:
Limited menu, everything is fried in oil/grease, and you'll end up getting really sick. The place is small and dirty. Macaroni (for their macaroni salad) was over cooked and didn't resemble Hawaiian Macaroni salad. Fried Mahi Mahi was okay but wouldn't recommend it because I got severely sick after consumption. 

I would recommend not coming here unless you want to spike your blood sugar intake and cholesterol levels. There are other restaurants in the surrounding area like a Mexican and even a Filipino restaurant. I'm sure they are far better than this place.
author: K. E.

description: whats good I went there yesterday for lunch I ordered mixed barbecue plate very generous portion my only complaint that I wanted a side of broccoli she charged me $2 a lil steep but hey its sf very flavorful meat
author: chancellors m.

description: I had to deduct a star from them for the fatty short ribs, all fat! I got the 2 item combo and it was lots of food, 2 scoops of rice and one scoop of macaroni, chicken katsu and short ribs. The Chicken Katsu was real good perfectly cooked and great portions. The Shortribs were all FAT it was really greasy and chunks of fat, not very appealing. Go for the katsu.
author: Karen T.

description: I wanted to like this place and came here with high hopes.  I was sorely disappointed.  I didn't know it was possible to screw rice up, but it was dry and overcooked, and tasted like yesterday's rice.  The mahi mahi was flat, bland, and a little rubbery.  Oh, and it's not a fresh fillet.  How unfresh?  The cook walked over to the freezer and pulled out a few strips of frozen fish which she threw into the deep frier.  The mac salad was one-note and had waaayyyy too much mayo.  The spam musubi was the only thing that was decent.  Husband's mixed plate was similarly a disappointment.  Avoid.
author: Tara C.

description:
CHEAP EATS :]

the family that runs this location are very nice people, and definetely hook each order up! Been coming here since middle school, and have stayed loyal. 

Their Katsu Chicken and Loco Moco are pretty amazing. Their Masubis are pretty bomb here and reasonably priced. Your food is always fresh and made with the quickness!

Definetely a hole in the wall joint, but their service and food are amazing. I hope they never close!!
author: Shirley M.

description:
Cheap. Fast. Fulling.

This has been here for a loong time - before those L&L's came in! And SO much better than L&L!!!  

Small and busy - take your plate lunch to go and eat at the beach! 

BBQ Mixed Plate is Yum! Macaronni Salad is pretty good - just eat it first, doesn't taste too good warm.
author: Erika G.

description:
are you hungry? are you just going to be STARVING??! well, so keep this address on your GPS and GO STRAIGHT to Hawaiian Drive Inn #28!!!

loco moco and chicken catzu best plates on menu. you can seat there and TRY to finish your ration... (so HUGE plate). 

prices? just RIDICULOUS: less than 6/7$.

i'm already planning to come back asap.
author: Davide milidolo R.

description: Chicken katsu is yummy but their rice doesn't taste very good.
author: sandy s.

description: If you're ever nearby this is the place to go! Fast fresh and cheap!! So good! Delivery service isnt the greatest. Varies depending on what time it is and how busy they are. Waited three hours to get it after calling back to see if they did delivery yet. Still five stars since they were very nice when delivering (: worth the long wait. So fresh and delicious! Minimum of $20 or $25 for delivery though!
author: Jessica W.

description:
What can you not like about this place.

Cheap prices, Huge portions and tastes great.

The BBQ chicken is okay - a bit on the dry side

The Chicken Katsu here is BOMB. nicely breaded (not too heavy) and the chicken is soft, juicy and tender.

The macaroni salad here is a bit bland but still pretty good.

Spam musubi is pretty good. 

and did i mention that i got all this and an extra scoop of macaroni salad which fed 2 people abundantly for about $11.

Hole in the wall but a good hole in the wall.
author: Zu W.

description:
I work 2 blocks from this place, and it might end up sucking up all my salary. It's not expensive, but the chicken katsu here is SO yummy I think about it everyday. I'm doomed. 

2 friends and I met here for lunch one day. We went in, ordered at the front, and sat in the back after squishing pass a group of teenagers. I ordered a mini chicken katsu, my friends ordered a mini curry chicken, and a mini bbq chicken. Everything came with rice and macaroni salad, and was about $4 each. 

The curry chicken tasted weird because of the texture of the meat. We couldn't decide which part of the chicken it came from, since it was cut awkwardly and tasted a little chewy. 

The chicken katsu was incredible and large in portions! Crispy... oh, so crispy. This is the katsu I think about everyday at work! The mac salad was a little plain compared to the katsu (after you dip the sauce). [oh, I learned that chicken katsu had the katsu sauce on the side, and chicken cutlet had gravy sauce on top]

This place is TINY, only about 3-4 tables. The person who took our order was patient when we were ordering. There is no server here, and we had no idea who to ask for a glass of water. 

I'm definitely coming here again. I don't know what they put into their katsu, but I ate it once and I'm hooked and suffering from withdrawal symptoms.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
As a former balboa student, you seriously can't get any other cheap food better than this. There's ALWAYS a butt load of balboa students here and there's a reason for it. They give you massive portions of good old greasy food. Delicious all the way, my bf swears I have a problem cuz I always want to eat here.

Btw, it's not one of your fancy places; it a hole in the wall. Don't come and expect excellent decor. You get your food and gtfo so you can eat at home asap!
author: Katie O.

description: Great place to go to after a get off from class. I place is usually crowd around 3:30- 5:00pm during the week days. This is the best place to get your Loco Moco and french fries for a cheap price.
author: Siuhin C.

description:
This place is straight hole in the wall! But, don't let it fool you, the food is amazing!!

If I had to rate any Hawaiian food joint the BEST in SF, it'll be this! 

They give you a generous amount of food. Even the mini meals are HUGE. You won't be disappointed. The people who work there are nice and friendly. If you want to change anything or add something to your meal, they don't hesitate and will give you what you want.

The spam musubi is so yummy and freshly made to order. 

The one thing that prevented me from giving it a perfect 5 stars would be the crowd it attracts. 

Maybe it was just our bad luck for going that day at that time, but there was a group of high schoolers who kept yapping and laughing annoyingly! I almost couldn't enjoy my meal. BUT, aside of that, it's a must try if you are craving Hawaiian food!
author: Christina T.

description:
Much better than L&L's, that's a fact.  Plate lunches are usually not considered healthy, so if you're looking to eat nutritious food to begin with, you shouldn't be going to anyplace that serves plate lunches.  That being said, this place has the most reasonably priced and ono plate lunches here in SF.    

I stopped by around 6pm on a Wednesday and ordered the BBQ Short Ribs plate, regular size was $7.12 w/tax included.  Waited around 7-10 min. after I ordered - around three people were waiting before me and the seating area in the back, which is very limited, was understandably packed around that time.  The lady who took my order was nice and the only other worker in there was the guy grilling the meats.   

Got home and ate half of it for dinner and brought the other half to work for lunch the next day - hey, ain't nothing wrong with eating leftovers. . . And the regular plate has enough food so that you can eat half of it later or for another day, unless you happen to be mad hungry.

Short ribs = winnah's; mac salad = creamy, much better tasting than other places claiming to be "Hawaiian"; rice = again, much better than the other "Hawaiian" joints out there - believe me, I'm very particular about the type of rice a place uses.  Trust me folks, take it from someone who has lived in the islands for twenty years - this Hawaiian Drive Inn has no doubt the best BBQ Short Ribs plate lunch that SF has to offer.
author: Kahanalei M.

description: Two words... Chicken katsu!!!  Theirs is amazing.... The breading doesn't fall off, and you seriously get a mountain of it!  I think that I get maybe three or four meals out of one order.  Pretty much anything there is a great value for your money, so you have to check it out.  The only complaint I have is that their Mac salad is so so....  I much prefer Ono's or my mom's Mac salad, but that's just me being picky :)
author: L. W.

description:
This place is ranked best Hawaiian BBQ in SF on yelp, so heck I'd give it a try. It's quite a far drive, but I thought it would be worth it. 

My order I shared with a friend was:
-Plate C: Short Ribs, Teriyaki Chicken, and Teriyaki Steak
-Two Item: Kitchen Katsu & Teriyaki Chicken

The quantity of the food was definetely large, I was only able to finish about half to 3/4 of my food. My friend on the other hand couldn't even get to half.

The place is family run, and they were very respectful and kind. No attitude whatsover. I wanted to know other places on mission and they offered me a map, which I thought was kind.

Food, this is where I kind of got disappointed. I noticed they marinate their meat, but for some reason I couldn't taste it. On top of that they forgot to pack the Teriyaki sauce for both meals. To be the best rated Hawaiian bbq, I expected a little more, but it tasted just like any other. 

One Star for customer service, another for price, and last star for quantity.
author: Austin N.

description:
My favorite Hawaiian food joint closed down a while ago, so I found this hole-in-the-wall through yelp and decided to give it a try.

We ordered the chicken katsu and loco moco, which were served quickly. Both of these came with a pile of rice and macaroni salad.  With two drinks, the bill was VERY reasonable at just under $15.

The staff was very nice and served us quickly - though we were the only people in there at the time.

The food was good, but was a little on the bland side.  The gravy on the loco moco needed 'something'..  not to sound harsh, but it was a more inline with something I would expect served in a hospital cafeteria.  

The food was OK, the portions were gigantic, the staff was very friendly and the price was great - but I'll keep looking for my new favorite.
author: Jory M.

description:
Cheap, Greasy, Good.
Lots of food for a good price.

Loco Moco - Delicious and a favorite, $6.25 - two meals in one
Teriyaki Steak - Flavorful but a bit on the dry side, had this one time

Not the nicest place.  It does have a seating area inside but they keep the door open and it can get cold.  I get it to go.
author: Po L.

description: I love this place. It's a hole in the wall and although they have a couple tables in the rear I've always done take out. It's tough to beat this place because the quality of food is on par with the other hawaiian places, they're extremely affordable (approximately $7 for their "entrees"), and they give you a lot of food for your money. The only downfall to this place is they're cash only but that's kind of expected at a place like this. If this is your first time going I'd suggest getting the chicken katsu dinner or getting the combo plate, but make sure to pick chicken katsu as one of your 2 meats. If you're not that hungry then they have burgers too for around $4 or so. FYI, if you're going to do take out then make sure you let your food breathe a little otherwise it'll get soggy because this place uses plastic containers which doesn't let the steam get out.
author: Ken C.

description:
LocoMoco!  Saimin!  Chicken Katsu!  MUSUBIS!!!!!!!!!!!!!

You're not going to go away hungry when you leave Hawaiian Drive In.  You will, however, leave with slightly more clogged arteries.  At least you won't be broke; prices are so reasonable, you'll have money left over to contribute to your bypass surgery.
author: Freccia S.

description: I got the chicken teriyaki and a loco moco to-go. chicken, BURNT. patty on loco moco, BURNT. first time, i ate my chicken WITHOUT THE TERIYAKI! second time, same thing. SERIOUSLY?! don't you people feel bad serving burnt food? shame.
author: Kali Anna W.

description: I love this place. Yeah, the outside might look sketchy, but once you taste the deliciousness they cook on the inside and see the prices, you'll definitely be coming back for more.
author: Olympia Z.

description:
If it was possible to give a 0 star review then this is the place that deserves it! I'm the type that can chow down on pretty much anything but this was one meal even a garbage mouth like me can't shove down. 
I work in the restaurant industry and while standing in line, I cant help but to notice all the unsanitary practices. I can name a dozen of health code violations, but I'm only going to list the most important ones that a restaurant should be mandatorily forced to comply with in order to be "serve safe." 
Violation 1. Cross contamination of cooked food and raw food especially CHICKEN! I watch as the lady take a box of raw breaded chicken out of the fridge and put it in the fryer with her bare hands, then immediately touch and handle cooked chicken without gloves or washing her hands.  
Violation 2. No gloves and no hand washing! Not only did she touch the cooked food after touching the raw food. She is also the cashier, which means handling cash and handling food interchangeably. Furthermore a man I assume just came back from his break because he came from outside of the restaurant and I watch as he went straight back to work without washing his hands. There is a sink with the sticker of all the hand-washing procedure, but there is no soap dispenser anywhere near the sink so I'm gonna guess that hand-washing is not a common practice at this place. 
Violation 3. Unsanitary work environment. This place was a mess! If I was them I would not put the cooking area in the front of the store where everyone can see your mess! Clean up once in a while to keep your work area clean and clutter free. 
 
I would have just walked out of this place but I want to give this place a fair chance, beside my GF was on my ass and she is not a happy girl when hungry. LOL 
Now lets get to the food. THE FOOD IS DISGUSTING!!!!  It's pretty hard to fuck up steamed rice, macaroni salad, and fried chicken katsu, but this place managed to do so. If you have any decent skills as a cook those things are a no brainer. The pork chop, bbq chicken, and loco moco are all pre-made and sits in the hot station, which mean they are not cooked to order and not fresh. The cuts of meat is really cheap and comes with mostly fat. The chicken katsu is brown instead of golden. The only reason they give you so much chicken is because they pound the shit out of it to make it super thin so you get 4 piece of finish product with only 1 reg size chicken breast. To keep prices low the quality of product should not be the one that gets cut. After not finishing my meal I got the SHITS. -_- not surprised. 

I don't understand why this place has so many 4 star and up reviews. Maybe only high school kids and busy workers come here for a quick and cheap lunch. I will not be coming here again. HEAR MY WORDS. DO NOT COME HERE UNLESS YOU HAVE THE NEEDS TO GET THE RUNS!!!
author: Tony N.

description:
It's ALL ABOUT the grilled meats here, folks.  You can smell it anywhere within a 1-block radius, which makes me staaarved whenever I pass by.  I have to admit that for the first few months living in the area, I ate here way, way too much because the portions are so huge, the prices are so cheap, and the teriyaki chicken is just THAT GOOD.  I've finally developed enough willpower to NOT go in and order Hawaiian every time I smell it.

Teriyaki chicken is boring, you say.  Yes, every Asian place seems to serve teriyaki chicken, even if it's a freaking Chinese restaurant, but Hawaiian Drive Inn's teriyaki chicken is not overly doused in an overly sweet, corn-starchy sauce - the seasoning's barbecued right in, as it should be.  The chicken is nice and tender, salty enough and won't make you need to deep-hydrate afterwards - and the broccoli as a side (which I occasionally order to make myself feel minutely healthier) is actually steamed well, with just enough flavor.  Macaroni salad is hit-or-miss for most people here, but I tend to like it because it doesn't outright choke me in mayonnaise (although it's probably just doing that sneakily).

Sentimental neighborhood favorite for me.  For others, like I said, can't go wrong with the barbecued meats, musubi, or chicken katsu, but stay away from the curry at all costs.  It's your normal S&B but with inedible chunks of unidentifiable meat in it.  I'd probably eat the chicken katsu more if I weren't so Chinese about not eating too much deep-fried foods because of "yeet hay."

Be warned:  you WILL leave this place smelling of barbecued teriyaki deliciousness.
author: Christina H.

description:
A hole in the wall. Not really a restaurant, more of get your food and gtfo. I come here about once a week and have their number stored on my cellphone so i can pickup fast....

With that said...this place is the shit.

Shit load of food...good food....MEAT......not some veggie crap...and god damn cheap.

They don't give you mickey mouse portions...you get a crap load...enough that your anus might be overworked later if you eat it all at once...

7 bucks will stuff you. 

Good food + Cheap + Lots = Happy Carnivore.
author: Steven C.

description:
Food:  4 out of 5 - This is for the price.  For about $5 I got the Katsu Chicken plate.  It had about 3-4 chicken breast (type of breast) breaded, two lumps of sticky rice and a lump of macaroni salad.  The chicken was good (white and dark meat), the sticky rice was sticky for the right reasons and the macaroni salad was macaroni salad.  You get alot more then you pay for in food and taste.   My friend got the mini BBQ chicken, all good there too!  Mini was like a breast and half. 

Price:  5 out of 5 - What can you say you can eat a whole meal for under $4 (the plates are a bit large so go for a mini).  Not many places you can say that to now adays.

Atmosphere:  2 out of 5 - A hole in the wall place that is at the bare bones.  There are chairs in the back that are comfy enough, don't stare too long at where the cook the food and you will be fine (I like to have some mystery to that sometimes and this is a place I rather have the mystery).  

Service:  4 out of 5 - Hey they are not charging much, I give them props for being super friendly and smilling.  They served us the food at our table and gave us options to take the order at the table or at the counter.
author: Dennis C.

description:
Sure, you may be swayed by the prettier hawaiian restaurant just across the street if it is actually open for business ... but this place offers a pretty sweet value for your chicken katsu-desiring self.

The portions served here are pretty large - for $6 or so, you get a full helping of whatever it is you're ordering from the full-size menu. They have smaller portions for the $4.50 price range - just as good, just not as much of good for your pallate.

I've had short ribs here along with chicken katsu - I gotta give my love to the chicken katsu.  For short ribs, I prefer I Luv Teriyaki on Potrero near the Safeway at Potrero Center.  ANyhow ... .if you happen to be near the Hawaiian Drive Inn and would like some fatty goodness that is way easy on the wallet, this is a good spot to drop in.
author: Jamie W.

description:
this is the go to spot for hawaiian drive inn! a hole in the wall, with food thats always great! i love their mini plates. perfect amount of food and very reasonably priced! also their spam musubis are good too. =)

service isnt bad either, they're pretty friendly! =)
author: Lisa N.

description:
Cheap prices, great tasting, can you ask for much more.

Okay, so it's probably not the healthiest thing to eat, but who eats like this everyday for every meal?

Honestly though, only thing I ever tried (and continue to get) is the Chicken Katsu, damn that katsu is good!!
author: Mike V.

description:
I have been eating here for the past 4 years and am never dissapointed.
They could use a remodeling of the interior but then we would be paying $2-$3 more for the food. The cook always hooks regulars up( well me atleast) The usual order is a "korean" style short ribs "english cut" and a mini chicken katsu. Hawaiian guava drink to satisfy my sugar cravings.
Oh don't forget the mac salad is always good when it's enjoyed cold.If your taking out make sure you get to it before the hot rice and meat warm it up."get an extra scoop"
author: Peter J.

description:
The place looks pretty ghetto but don't let looks stop you from getting some good Hawaiian food. It's a fast food-type place so do not eat there. I would just order out. They do delivery and you can just call to pick up later. They're really good about that.

I recommend the chicken terriyaki, chicken katsu, musubis, and the loco moco. It's cheaper than the other Hawaiian place down the street, Da Kine.
author: Rick C.

description:
This Hawaiian Drive Inn is a club house with a kitchen.  Lovely staff  that work here,  A++++ Light speed cooking fills the tummy fast and keeps the wallet FAT!  Very limited seating, I suggest stopping by before or after lunch because Balboa High is a few blocks down the road. 

Be proud Excelsior!
author: Abraham E.

description: I found this place because it had good reviews on yelp. We were starving and didn't have much time, so I figured this place will do. There is no parking, so you have to find something along the streets. We ended up having to park a distance away. It took a good 15-20 minutes for our food to come out and I wasn't very impressed with their chicken teriyaki. It wasn't bad, just not good. It didn't seem to have the teriyaki flavor I was craving for.
author: Marifel J.

description: Great food, quick service! This little whole in the wall has been here for as long as i can remember since moving to excelsior many years back.. And  Im here atleast once a week! Huge portions so the mini plate under $5 usually hits the spot!
author: Faisal P.

description: Food is very good.Love coming here after school for spam musubi , chicken katsu musubi or the chicken katsu meal. I also love their macaroni salad.
author: Heat L.

description:
Decided to come here after reading the great reviews from other yelpers.  We almost missed finding this place as the outside isn't very impressive.  Its a hole in the wall type of restaraunt.  It definitely delivers though and proves that you can't judge a book by its cover.

Inside, there is a small open kitchen where your order is taken.  The menu is featured on the wall, fast food style with pictures.  The service was great and friendly.  

There are several small tables in the back.  They look like tables you might find in a  local bowling alley, functional but not too pretty.

We ordered Chicken Katsu and the Barbeque Mixed Plate.  They were huge generous portions which included rice and also macaroni salad.  The Katsu was absolutely delicious.  The breading was crunchy and it was deep fried.  It was extremely satisfying.  The short ribs were tasty and good.  The macaroni salad was not very good.  It was very bland actually and had a lot to be desired.  I realized after a couple of bites that it wasn't worth the calorie intake and just avoided it alltogether.  I'm still giving this place five stars though because the rest of the food was just plain excellent.  And, the price leaves you smiling.  Two thumbs up.  Would definitely come back!
author: Candice M.

description:
I notice a lot of recent reviews for this place...could it be approaching bandwagon status?  Probably, since I never would have found it without the Yelp buzz.  

So, first things first: this is a quintessential dive in a very divey part of town (right across the street from the excellent Taqueria Guadalajara).  Most people get the food to go here, but you can sit down and appreciate the lack of ambience.  (Indeed, this place is a serious contender for the diviest restauarant prize: bright lights, white everything, weird pink stripes on the walls, the 70's-style rock facade in the back, and of course every intimate detail of the kitchen sitting more or less in plain view.)

Even if you're eating in, you'll get your food in a styrofoam container with plastic utensils (which is a bit of a pain when you're trying to cut meat).  We had 3 people (including a very hungry teenager), and we ordered the chicken katsu and the bbq mixed plate, and it turned out to be more than enough, especially considering the generous piles of rice and macaroni salad they come with.  

Clearly, the Yelp consensus is that the chicken katsu is awesome, but what exactly is it?  It's basically just breaded chicken strips, only zillions of times better than the frozen kind.  Who knew those could be respectable?  BBQ meats were all great too.  They brought us a little container of sauce but it wasn't nearly enough.  I don't know if you can get more for free, but you'll definitely need some if you want to cover all the meat and rice.  The macaroni salad has potential, but it really needs less mayo and more zip.

It may not be the same as eating in Hawaii, but it's nice to see that SF has even this relatively obscure cuisine covered.  (In fact there's another Hawaiian place across the street...could there be a whole Hawaiian food scene here that I don't know about?)  In short, portions and prices are great, and with more sauce and better mac salad they could probably be the Mitchell's of Hawaiian food.  After all, it's only a matter of time before one of these dives puts the Excelsior on the [foodie] map.
author: Wes M.

description: Cheap and good. tried everything here and everything is good. I always get the mini plate and i can never finish everything and its only 4.95. I really like the chicken katsu and lemon chicken. When i get the Chicken katsu i ask for the teriyaki sauce instead it taste soo good. THe loco moco is really good some place their gravy is bland but this place the gracy is really good. when im not that hungry I get a chicken katsu musubi its only 1.60 and its really filling
author: Lisa D.

description: I use to go to school near here and would always order from here. Great food! Gets me full for a cheap price. Some would say their "service" is horrible, but they're very nice. At least to me they are. Specifically, I love their macaroni. They have the best one in the city, everyone else has some kind of weird smell to it. The chicken is usually big, not too fried. The chicken musubi is probably the thing I get the most, because IT'S SO GOOOOOOOD.
author: Iris L.

description: When my brother told me that he thought this place had shut down, I just about had a heart attack, but had to drive by just to make sure.  THANK GOD it is still open!!  Definitely a hole-in-the-wall that many people miss, but their chicken katsu is amazing!!  My brother and I used to always come here for take-out, and now, whenever I come home from college, we make sure to pay this place a visit.  He and I always get a loco moco, a chicken katsu, two spam musubis (they are so good here), and two chicken katsu musubis.  LOVE this place.
author: Tracey L.

description: Walkin in... ordered chicken katsu food was good and came fast ...service is good reasonable prices. Place is clean and kickback. Come here when I'm in the area and crave some good Hawaiian food
author: Marvin C.

description: Recently stopped by the HDI and things have improved .The BBQ chicken were so sarap!Service is very quick and friendly.I 'll be back!
author: Scott Q.

description:
Please don't go to any other Hawaiian BBQ, in SF , or anywhere else.  
This is the best place to get a dinner for under $10.  I always either get the Mixed BBQ plate, tne Seafood Mix Plate, or the Chicken Katsu.  It is the BEST food that you can get homemade for under $10 under 20 minutes.  I have tried so many other Hawaiian BBQ places, and no one came even close to beating this one. 
Huge portions, cheap pricing, and in an easy location.  Only warning, EAT YOUR MACARONI SALAD FIRST.  Hot mayonaise is never a good thing.
author: Janet R.

description:
This place is one of my many great lunch spots, it is within walking distance of my friends job which is great because parking is a bit intense, I can never find a spot.

As for the the actual establishment and food, I love it, although I prefer to call in my orders and pick them up. But when I do my food is always ready when I get there cooked to greasy perfection. The portions are very large and filling, I usually get full from just half my meal and then have enough to take home and eat later.

In addition the staff is supper friendly and chatty.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Finally gave this place a shot the other day after patronizing Da Kine across the street for some time. I ordered the seafood combo with Deep-Fried shrimp, Mahi Mahi, and Teri Chicken ($6.80), and my wife had the combo with Chicken Katsu and Teri Short Ribs for around the same price. The main draw here seems to be enormous quantities of food for extremely cheap prices. The quality varied quite a bit, but we definitely found some winners. The Teri Chicken was excellent (at least as good as Da Kine), and I would definitely order it again. The fried shrimp were also excellent. The mahi mahi was dry and kind of stale tasting, and I robably wouldn't order it again, altough I might try the mahi mahi sandwich (for $1.95, how can you go wrong). Maybe I just don't like Hawaiian stlye fried mahi, because I didn't particularly care for it at Da Kine either.

The short ribs were decent although I would probably try the Teri Steak or Pork Chops before getting the short ribs again. The Katsu was dry and a little fatty. I would definitely stick with the Teri Chicken in the future.

The rice was well cooked and they give you a ton. A mini plate is likely enough for any normal person. The mac salad, on the other hand, was slathered in mayonaiise and pretty tasteless. I would probably opt for extra rice and skip the mac next time.

Easily 3 stars, possibly 4. I will definitely go back, if only for the ridiculously low prices. I look forward to trying some other menu items (the Teri Steak looked good on the grill, and I want to sample the saimin), and will update when I do.

I would say Da Kine might be a bit better (and they have pearl drinks), but the overall value at HDI28 is superior.
author: Brian H.

description:
One of the better Hawaiian places in the city. The food is always good and the prices are even better. The place is small so you gotta get lucky to get a seat inside or you'll be ordering take out. I love their loco moco here more than anywhere else (and I don't usually order loco moco), and also recommend everything else on the menu. The couple who own the place are really nice so that really makes this place a winner.

The only real downsides to this place is that it is small, and parking can be a little difficult at times.
author: Rommel N.

description:
Cheap. Cheap. Cheap. 
Beyond that...meh.
Ono on Sloat is better overall. 
Have to admit, the Katsu is greasalicious!
Not worth the trip to the hizzle.
author: Mr. S.

description:
I hate to go against the grain here, but I didn't see all the fuss about this place, and I love cheap fatty Hawaiian BBQ.

What I didn't like about this place is that the Loco moco sauce was goopy and flavorless.

Also the mac salad was tasteless compared to other places I've been to.  True it isn't supposed to be able to stand on its own as a dish, but eating it with the meal wasn't satisfying, perhaps more mayo would be the cure.

I had the BBQ mix plate which was okay, the ribs were thicker than other places but fatty.  The chicken also wasn't as flavorful as could have been, again not tasty enough to really stand alone.  

After reading these reviews it seems that I should have tried the chicken katsu.
author: Stephen H.

description:
I've been to this place a couple times now and it's been pretty good so far. 
Things that are good:
1. Loco Moco
2. BBQ Mixed Plate
3. Saimin Noodle Soup

Cheap tasty food! Don't forget the side macaroni salad too!
author: Albert C.

description:
My benchmark is L&L, despite my general anti-chain sentiment. This place comes close: lots of meat in the BBQ chicken mini plate, the rice is mushy (just the way I like it), and the mac salad is okay. The Portuguese sausage musubi is a nice change from the usual Spam. But L&L gets the edge in flavor.

Dingy, low on atmosphere: get your grub to go. And what's with Da Kine Hawaiian opening up virtually across the street? A reaction?
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I give this place a 4 just because of judging a book by its covers. I've come here for a long time, and get the same consistent service. Wait in line, get my food, enjoy the food (which is good), and leave. Nothing too special. 
The place is really really tiny, not the cleanest place on earth, but the food speaks for itself. Greasy, tasty, meat, with rice and macaroni salad. 
Not the greatest hawaiian food, not the best restaurant, but good ol comfort food. If you like hawaiian food, this place is def a stop at!
DId i mention for the amount of food you get, you spend little to nothing?!
author: Eric A.

description: I can only say that the spam musubi is good. The other stuff is really hit or miss. I have had the BBQ mixed plate which was good but the ribs are a little dry and thin. The fish plate was kinda gross- greasy and too fishy to be fresh- and the chicken was gamey.The mac salad is also weird tasting, not sure how they messed that one up.
author: M K.

description:
The only real thing I don't like about Hawaiian Drive Inn.. The macaroni salad.  The stuff is just too bland and runny for my taste.  I avoid it every time I go there. 

The chicken katsu and the teriyaki short ribs are my two favorite things there.. The katsu is breaded just enough and fried to the point that it is still succulent.  The short ribs are just sweet meaty goodness.. I've had the loco moco, but I wouldn't recommend it cause I think their brown gravy taste as bland as their macaroni salad.  Stick to the katsu or the bbq teriyaki.

I love the fact that no matter if you eat in or take out, you still get served in a take-out box and plastic utensils.  That way, they have nothing to clean up.. There are a few tables in the back.  The staff is pretty friendly.  Make no mistake.. This place is a greasy hole-in-the-wall, just the way I like it.
author: A. H.

description: she always be hooking me up with hella meat or that's the way it is... been eating this place for over 10 years and i just love it... way better then the hawaiian drive in the open across the street... the nerve, how the can you even do that... this store look like hole in the wall but the stuff good, you go across the street... its more modern and look better but the food is crappy, trust me on this one... you order the chicken cutsue here, you get chicken and light batter... you order across the street, you get flat chicken with ton of battler... this place will be original and never will change... think about getting some today :)
author: JessePanda C.

description: This is one of my favorite lunch spots in my neighborhood. They definitely do not skimp on the portions. They give you A LOT of meat. You can get full off one of the mini plates for sure. I usually get the chicken katsu mini plate which comes with mac salad and rice. At around $5, I consider it to be one of the best bargains in the city. Also, the lady who works there is very nice.
author: Bill K.

description:
There aren't that many places in the city that serve Hawaiian food that's good. It's really hard to find restaurants that fit the bill when it comes to making onolicious food. 

Hawaiian Drive Inn is good but not great. I had their Chicken Katsu Curry and my husband had their BBQ mix plate. I have to say that the curry was just ok. I like curry and I know good curry when I taste it but this not something I would order again. 

Now on the other hand, I had a little taste of my husband's chicken and it was great. Nice, tender and juicy the way chicken should be. 

If you decided to come here for something go for the BBQ mix plate, you can't go wrong. 

*Cheers*
author: Jessica L.

description:
***3.5 STARS***

The little Hawaiian Drive Inn...I've been to your competition (DaKine's) across the street, and now it is your turn, my friend!  The food is a little better than DaKine's, you get a little more meat (and at a Hawaiian BBQ joint, that's what matters), and it's a little cheaper.  It is kinda dingy inside and the layout (grill / kitchen in front, seating in back?) is kinda weird, and they only take cash, but if you want more meat for less money, skip DaKine's and go to Hawaiian Drive Inn.

BTW...many people have voted for "NO" on Delivery...THIS PLACE DELIVERS FREE ON ORDERS OVER $20.  I am looking at the menu that I got at the place today.
author: Garrett C.

description: What's not to love? Cheap pricing and delicious food! I love the people who run this place, they're all so nice! I used to come here at least three times a week when i was younger, but my metabolism has slowed down since then.. gotta watch those calories. I always ordered the BBQ chicken with two scoops of macaroni salad.. always MINI because they give you SO MUCH food for your money! I know parking can be a bother, but I always parked my car int he BK parking lot ((hush hush)).. Limited seating, but its there.
author: Neek W.

description: It's nice to have a great place so close to home. I'm going to school full time, so it's great that the place is so cheap. Quick, friendly service. Great big portions. It isn't fancy, but that's what makes it so good. What do you expect when you can feed three adults, with drinks, for $18? And that's with enough left for another meal. Just go with it.
author: Andy T.

description:
So even though I live a few blocks from here, I decided to order delivery simply because my boyfriend and I are lazy fatasses sometimes and can't live without our Hawaiian Drive Inn fix. 
The lady on the phone is extremely abrupt but not unkind, be prepared to repeat some things because there tends to be a lot of background noise. Or my connection here sucks. I think it's a mixture of both.
Quick quick delivery, but then again I live pretty close. The burgers are big and JUICY and great, the curry is good but the Teriyaki Mix Plate is where it's at. Chicken Katsu portions are crazy-generous -- Basically the general rule is that you can never go wrong with more meat from this place. I am crazy for their teriyaki stuff and hamburger. There are always leftovers but those always go over well too, because it's that good. So cheap, so good, so much, I'd live off of this place except I think my colon would explode. Yeah, TMI but buy their food. :)
author: Cindy L.

description:
awww yeah

this is what im talking about man

cheap eats, but they give you a shitload of food

you get that "BOOM" full feeling afterwards

all mellowed out and shit

yeahhhhhh, this is the shit.

and right down the street from el farolito if you have the APOCALYPTIC munchies

4 stars
author: Edmund C.

description:
My friend kept raving about this place and took me here for a taste when we were in the area. 

To be honest, my sister and I didn't find what was so great about the food here. It was edible, but I found it too oily! The BBQ beef tasted all right, but nothing too spectacular, and I never was a fan of macaroni salad. 

I suppose it's good if you want something cheap!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Good, greay, salty goodness at a cheap price. The spam sushi was really good and the plate full of 'bbq' meats was awesome. Big portions and fast service make this a perfect neighborhood dive.
author: Quantas G.

description: The original hawaiian drive inn.. yay! =) I came here recently with my boyfriend and this place is pretty good! Its cheap and the people that work here are really nice! Both people in the front greeted us and thanked us for coming after we left! There are only 4 tables here so getting a table is kind of hard.. its a really small place but a good place to eat at!
author: Heather C.

description: Chicken Katsu is awesome.  BBQ ribs were just OK.  Portion size is huge and prices are very cheap, definitely a great value.
author: Kyle B.

description: the place is a moms and pops hawaiian bbq joint. the owners are extremely kind and the prices are sooo freakin CHEAAAP!!! especially for what you are getting and the quality of food! we ordered a mini chicken katsu, which came with about 2-3 whole pieces of chicken slabs. the mini short ribs came with 3 pieces of short ribs which is waaay more than what they give you in a REGULAR order at other hawaiian bbq places. we also ordered 2 spam musubi's which had the most flavorful teriyaki sauce. all this for $11! we stuffed our faces with the food and were soooo full! of course each meal came with a scoop of rice, a scoop of macaroni salad and cabbage. hands down, the best hawaiian bbq place i've had yet!
author: Tiffany C.

description: This joint is close to my mom's house and freakin' good Hawaiian bbq. Small hole in the wall place but don't let the exterior fool you. Masubis are $1.60 each so stock up! The portions are huge, even the mini plates. The meats are marinated nicely and everything is cooked to order. Family owned which is even better. They deliver with a $20 min and are open 7 days a week. Despite contrary belief sometimes it's the simple things in life that makes me smile!
author: Lola L.

description: I went to try out this location a few days ago to see if the katsu was really as great as everyone said it was, and I have to honestly say that it was disappointing.
author: BigAppetite ..

description: Oh talking about generous portion? I have never finished the full order of anything in there. Chicken katsu is truly favorite... yummmm with that bbq sauce... good heaven! I come to this place once a while since it's in my neighborhood. Call them before you come and they will have your order ready when you enter. Ever since the boba place across the street opened up, I felt their portion is getting bigger. So it is truly a steal. Everything here is good. If not katsu, I get the seafood combo, since I love seafood. And yes, they are all battered and totally fried deep, not just deep fried. The BBQ combo is goodies also. I love the teri short ribs. Short ribs are truly so goodies. And the macaroni salad... oh... me love this place. Gawd, writing this makes me hungry...
author: dannydan d.

description: For the price and portions, this place cannot be beat. I make a pilgrimage here at least once a month, and have been doing so for 6 or more years. Anyone who gives this place a 3 star rating or below without a LEGITIMATE excuse seriously needs to learn to be OBJECTIVE. Don't come in here expecting a triple A diamond dining experience, for what it is (which is large portions for a low price) Its a godsend in a city where "How I cool I look" eating food takes precedence over how food should actually taste.
author: N B.

description: Their macaroni salad is the best I've ever had. The teriyaki beef is full of flavor, and the staff is very friendly.
author: Michelle T.

description: I like this Hawaiian Drive Inn instead of the one across the street. I think its Ono Hawaiian. The katsu sauce is way better than any other place. I tried the chicken katsu and they give you a lot. Its very crunchy and pleasant when you bite it. The mac salad is also very tasteful. My sister always gets an extra side of it because she loves it soo much. Every other mac salad tastes sour. Their korean bbq ribs are on point. The spam masubi is good too. They do put a lot of rice in it tho, I must say. No me gusta. This place seems more friendlier, maybe because we've been coming here for a while and they're my customers too. Living in the Excelsior, I haven't really taken notice of this place. It really is a hole in the wall.
author: Abby A.

description: WOW..... I can't believe this little place has received so many reviews!This place has been a favorite of mine for years. The place is small, but they do have seating available. The macaroni salad is not made to eat by itself, often a mistake made by newcomers. Everything compliments each other on the plate....a little of this & a little of that! Get it, got it, good! Its affordable & delicious! They have everything from Teriyaki, Deep Fried Mahi-Mahi & Chiken Katsu, Hamburgers & even breakfast......of course they have SPAM!!!! Love this place 5 stars from me!!
author: Karen H.

description: I would eat this every day if I didn't want to live past 40.  Alas, I must struggle with my mac salad addiction daily and resist that mayo goodness.  Mahi Mahi, BBQ Mixed plate, Chicken Katsu...all chronic.  Wash that grease down with a Hawaiian Sun Passion Orange drink. WORD.
author: Tommy O.

description: I was introduced to the Loco Moco here! Since then, it has set the bar for me for other Hawaiian places I've tried.  The menu is very easy on the wallet and the portions are huge, as traditional Hawaiian food is served.  The place is very small and parking can be a pain, but it's worth the hassle to try this place at least once.  By the way, no other Loco Moco has come close to this place.
author: R B.

description: After briefly living in hawaii it is hard to say no to a plate lunch. It was also hard to find one that didn't cost a lot and could compare in terms of portions. I knew about this place when I went to high school in the area, but never went in thinking it was dirty. But no folks, 99 of 100 on their green health inspection card, mahi mahi, katsu, and a mini plate under 5 bucks, truly a gem in this part of the city.
author: Niki M.

description: I love hole-in-the-wall places! The food is good, the prices are low, and the service is quick. I've only had the teriyaki chicken with broccoli meal, but I'm sure the other food is decent.
author: Vicki L.

description: The food here is hot and cheap.  They give you alot of whatever you order off.  They have the various bbq rice plates.  Usually I get the BBQ pork chops.  The problem I had here last time was that there was almost a fight between patrons becuase they were young punks trying to out "scarface" each other.
author: Stevezee C.

description:
Their Service? It's alright. The lady seems to have a great memory if that's what you're looking for. Surprisingly she doesn't need to write anything down even if it gets really crowded. And everyone seems to try their best to get the cooking done. 

Their food: I get the usual chicken katsu which I'm satisfied with. I also like their chicken(spam) musubi; costing only $1.60 each. 

I have nothing more to say but my rating says what I need to say.
author: Vicky H.

description: Not a place where you can take a big group, but if yer on the go for take out, it's great to get yer teriyaki fix.  Pretty cheap, a lunch will run you around $5.00 (unless it's the short ribs, which I highly advise.)
author: Richie W.

description: for the price, they hook it up i get a a mountainful of chicken katsu and one extra helping of macaroni for all under 7 bucks....yea budz...huge portions.....pretty friendly str8forward customer service
author: Sang L.

description: This place has been serving Hawaiian food before it became Uber popular.  Their portions are HUGE, and the food, though grease-laden, is extremely Yummy.  I never feel guilty (budget-wise) about getting food here, because it's SOO within my price range (since I usually find a way to spend my hard-earned dollars on something unplanned).  Parking is not convenient in any way, shape or form, but it's not impossible.  A definite must-eat.
author: brenda b.

description: I've eaten at the one on San Pedro Road (?) and this one in the Excelsior is the best. Prices are reasonable (CHEAP!) and the portions are bigger (YUM!). I haven't read any good reviews about the one on San Bruno. I've also eaten and different L&L's and so far, Hawaiian Drive Inn on Mission have the best ono grindz!
author: Neni E.

description: BUDGET! No lie. Great serving portions, will hit the spot within your tummy and your wallet/purse.  I like to go in the middle of the afternoon, it's emptied and you get to soak the beautimous rock wall that seems so out of place yet distinctly Excelcsior...
author: RJ L.

description:
im down, we've been eating at this place for 10 years.

if you ask my grandmother now about chicken, she will without failure respond with 'AHHH, CHICKEN, I _HATE_ CHICKEN'

and anytime you stop by there is without failure at least 1 leftover box from this spot.

if i have had a great sushi dinner or maybe some gary danko or zuni cafe or something delicious, i love to follow up the dinner with a spam masubi from this spot.

also, they serve a $1.60 cheese burger, a unique chinese-style hamburger with nearly no condiments, similar to that of a mcdonalds cheese burger but significantly more artisan, a unique chinese style hamburger that would not be ranked against traditional chinese hamburgers such as beeps, whiz burger, HRD, etc, but could stand up against them have there be an open freestyle chinese burger competition.
author: christopher a.

description: Can you say KATSU??  The atery clogging chicken, battered and deep fried is awesome!  But lately, I have just been buying the BBQ chicken, as it just seems to be healthier ... but maybe not.  The burgers are pretty descent too.  This place is pretty greasy, and the walls look like they need a washing of TSP.  Even the business cards on the corkboard are greasy. The teri steak is pretty good too!  The servings are huge and you can feed yourself for just a few $$.
author: Michael M.

description:
best chicken katsu around, hands down.  i'm always sooooo excited when i'm at a party and i see that familiar tray of katsu...i don't know what magic they're working but somehow they manage to fry up this delicious wonder that never gets soggy, remains crisp hours later (if it lasts that long, usually it's devoured so quickly!), and hardly feels/tastes greasy or oily.  mmmm, i'm getting hungry just thinking about it.

what happened to the colma location on san pedro road? anyone?
author: Jen P.

description: This place used to be my favorite place to go afterschool, afterwork, and whenever I was nearby. I came here almost everyday after school and work and got the chicken musubis or the mini chicken rice plate. My sister and I came here so often the employees already knew what we wanted. The employees are very nice and friendly.
author: Nelson G.

description: I love this place!! Close to my house, good cheeseburger, good chicken katsu, good food!! It's cheap and good!! Make friends with the young guy that works there because if he's friends with you like he is with me, he'll give you the food for free!! About half the time that I go there, he gives me the burger for free!!
author: Henry D.

description: OMG! Everything is good here, the burgers as well as the plates. You also get alot for what you pay for. This is the place to go!!!!!!!!! Terriyaki Mix Plate, don't pass this up! cause it's the a mixture of all kinds of meat, two scoops of rice and helluh good macaroni man.
author: Katarina V.

description: I LOVE HAWAIIAN DRIVE INN!!! good deals for a tasty meal.
author: Bernadette B.

description: hands down...better than L&L. I love the chicken katsu. It is the best around. The Spam Musubi is pretty tasty too =D Try one of those hawaiian drinks *yum*
author: Bianca B.

description:
hawaiian barbecue has never had a healthy side, but it's always delicious

come here as often as you can if you have high metabolism, otherwise you'll be a diabetic in 6 months!
author: Charles C.

description: Great, fast service. They cook your meat on spot. The macaroni salad is one of the best I've ever had...yum. The price isn't bad, either, for the amount of food you get. Perfect if you're feeling too lazy to cook dinner but want something fast and yummy.
author: Ivy P.

description: Great, fast service and delicious, plentiful, and inexpensive food; what an awesome combo.  Parking is a little difficult in this area.  My favorites here are the loco moco and chicken katsu.  They pack as much food as possible in those styrofoam packages.  The burgers and spam musubi are not bad either.  I am not a fan of the mac salad though.  The place looks ghetto, but the place is usually packed.
author: Andy L.

description: Good, solid Hawaiian bbq.  Good food, huge portions, cheap price.   It's by no means a fancy place.  It's a dive with yummy, filling food.
author: Funk G.

description: I'm from Hawaii, and this place is a taste of home.  I eat here all the time and have a big smile on my face after I'm done.  What do I get?  BBQ beef mini plate and a side of kimchee.  Let's just say they do it right.  Yummy.
author: Reid O.

description: Good portions.  Good fast service.  Overall one of my favorite hawaiian bbq places.
author: Andy L.

description: I absolutely love this place! It is super cheap, and super good, and the staff is super nice. I ate here like every day through my pregnancy, craving me some hawaiian drive inn. It is best to order ahead and take it to go, its not so comfy here. But it is great, cheap food. Love them! Boo to L n L for moving across the street, so shady, this place has been here for years and you try to move in on their business, jerkfaces!
author: Lorain C.

description: The prices at this restaurant are pretty cheap and the food is usually good too.    The only problem is that there is no parking nearby and the restaurant is mostly for take out.  There are not many chairs or tables you can sit at.  I like this place but have to give them only two stars because the last couple of times I have gotten food from them, my brother and I have gotten sick.  Maybe we got the food on a off night.
author: Patricia L.

description: I woud've gave this place 5 stars, but the cook doesn't like me for some reason, so I give it only 4.  Maybe if the cook greeted me and said Hi, I would like it, but he always gives me a dirty look like I slashed his tires or something.
author: James C.

description: Love their mac salad!!  I always call ahead and it's ready when they say it is.  It very cheap and you get a lot of chicken on the chicken teriyaki mini meal.  I just wish they had a choice of white meat for the chicken fillets, even if it were extra $.  I still love their chicken teriyaki with an extra scoop of mac salad for an additional 50 cents!  Now that's a deal. A filling meal for under $5.  And it's tasty!
author: OLGA M.

description: I'm a long time customer of Hawaiian Drive Inn. Their food is scrumptious and the people that work there are really nice :) they add-on extra gravy and what-not WITHOUT charging me extra like Da Kine's across the street. Hawaiian Drive Inn's portions are EXTREMELY GENEROUS! Sometimes I can't even finish a whole MINI plate by myself :x Oh and not to forget, Hawaiian Drive Inn's prices are sooooo REASONABLE! If you're on a budget going to Hawaiian Drive Inn will NOT hurt your pockets! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
author: Sarah E.

description: Cheap, nice and quaint, very good, fast. That pretty much sums this place up. They're really nice too, they always let me use their little bathroom in that shed they have in the backyard.
author: Adrian L.

description: Order the loco moco plate! They have delivery too.
author: FRISCO P.

description: i was craving a burger. but i also had to go to one of my worksites in the excelsior. enter hawaiian drive inn #28. it was a toss up between that and Da Kine Hawaiian bbq across the street from it. i saw the words cheap and greasy and burgers in a bunch of yelp reviews.
