SOLD to the highest (erm, albeit cheap) bidder! aka ME! they had this $3,99 special that included your choice of burger (they had a few to choose from, including a mahi burger!), small (but they looked big to me) fries and a drink (i picked a can o' coke). my cheeseburger was fresh off the grill and very simple. no frills, no special sauce, just a bun, some mayo, a slice of cheese and fresh grilled goodness. the fries were nice and crispy and again, abundant for a small. me? quite happy and satisfied. i'll try the mahi next time.
author: ray e.

description: i love this place!! it's so delicious, whether you get a spam musubi, bbq burger, beef terryaki, short ribs, loco moco or even the hamburger steak! the only bad thing is having the mac salad. i prefer another scoop of rice! i am craving for some hawaiian drive inn right now!! the prices are reasonable and somewhat of big portions.
author: Ann L.

description: the dishes here are huge... it was enough for two meals so for a poor college student, this was a good value back in the day when i lived in the neighborhood and wanted something other than el farolito...
author: charlotte s.

description: kick ass hole-in-the-wall type place. a little bit cramped if you're considering eating there. but the prices are excellent and the portions are HUGE. i always enjoy this place.
author: Andrew D.

description:
food taste = 3.5
price / value = 3.5
service = 3
environment = 3

having lived in hawaii for many years, i had high expectations for this place after reading the reviews.  i can see how this place can be a hit or miss.

service was pretty much self-serve.  it's not like they come around to fill your cup with water or anything.

we ordered two plates: seafood combo and bbq combo.  the bbq combo was good.  not spectacular, but pretty darn close to what i used to get in hawaii.  seafood combo was pretty junk.  mostly breading instead of actual seafood.  mac salad on both plates was not that great either.

but i'm rather forgiving considering what i got at the L&L.

next time i come here, i'm getting a meat plate with all rice (substitute mac with rice).
author: Bryce K.

description: es goode. i like hawaiian drive inn better than the L&L up the street. the drive inn's portions i think are bigger. i think their macaroni salad is more tasty more maynonaise-y, but i like it. i usually can get pretty full from a mini order. and each mini order is about $3.50. so it's a good deal.
author: Bee C.

description: good peeps that work there and the food is ono.  hamburger steak plate is da bombbb!!  good spot for lunch...
author: Kawika C.

description: mmmm, everything is excellent! the food, the service, the price. i met an old friend here for dinner and was craving some hawaiian food. i ordered a mini plate of chicken katsu, shared it with my son, and still had leftovers! wow, $3.70 goes a long way. my husband got the regular plate of teriyaki pork chops and also had leftovers (and seriously, this guy eats till he's beyond full). the restaurant is typical - not fancy at all, serves everything on styrofoam with plasticware, BUT there are decent tables to sit at AND the place is pretty clean. the only thing that dampered our dinner was the next table with 6 loud obnoxious teenagers craving attention. oh wait, that was me about 12 years ago. nevermind. though my son enjoyed the entertainment and people-watching. will definitely come here again.
author: Tawny A.

description: yes, it is cheap.  and the mini plates always fill me up already but the rice that go with it is so mushy.  just kinda ruined it for me.  i personally don't think it's that great here.  other hawaiian fast food places have left a better impression on me than this one.
author: Vanessa C.

description: My mom, of all people, was the one who first introduced me to this place back when I was in high school!  Unable to resist the smell of deliciousness coming out the open door, she brought home a mini bbq chicken plate for us to sample and I've been hooked since!  10 years later, the bbq chicken is still my go-to order, but the chicken katsu, mahi mahi, bbq beef, and bbq mixed plate are all equally yummy.  I always take mine to go, but there usually are people who eat at the small tables in the back.  Parking can sometimes be tough, so do what I do: call in the order first, park at the bus stop on the corner (hey, if the cops can get away with doing this while they eat their burritos at El Farolito, then I can too!), and then run in to pick up and pay.  In and out in under 2 minutes ... just in time to get out of the way of the next bus!  Thx to my mom, this has been my go to spot for Hawaiian BBQ that has never disappointed me!
author: Lil Y.

description: this place is hella good.  Eventhough it is not the healthiest.  It does taste the best
author: Michelle J.

description: I ordered the teri-mixed meat plate yesterday. When i opened the box, i was shocked to see the amount of meat they placed on top of the rice and macro. Price was unbeatable and definitely will go back again!
author: Jebson C.

description: i come here once a week for regular bbq chicken and 2 spam masubis.  all that for less than $10.  keeps me full all day at work.
author: Roger W.
